Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas. El sueño es poder tener una casa para vivir tranquilos  con la familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta ordeñar ganado.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 57, is single and has three children.  He lives with his children in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  He is a member of the 25 De Febrero communal bank.  The bank is in the Guabito precinct, Zapotal province, Ventanas canton.  They devote themselves to agricultural work.

Pedro grows corn, bananas, and oranges.  He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, liquids, and Ranger for weeds.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the supplies needed for his crops.  His dream is to be able to have a house to peacefully live in with his family.  The challenges he faces are the pest infestations.

In his free time he likes to milk the cows.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, liquids, and Ranger for weeds.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. Guadalupe has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Guadalupe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Guadalupe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. Gina has a shop that sells squid and fish, like trout and sardines, per kilogram. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish and squid to sell. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish and squid for sale

loans.name: Ganho Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GANHO II est composé de onze personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Louise est mariée à un certain Lokonanto. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges, Louise vend depuis une dizaine d’années, divers produits et de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) dans sa région. Louise s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GANHO II, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The GANHO group is made up of 11 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé, in order to increase its business activity.

The group's representative, Louise, is the woman with her hand raised in the photograph. Louise is 56 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Lokonanto. The couple has six children, three of whom remain in their care. All of their children are educated. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

In order to contribute to the various expenses, Louise has been selling various products as well as akassa (local food made from corn starch) in her region for about 12 years now. She stocks up in a region of Benin. Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and revenue, Louise, along with the other members of GANHO, is seeking her first loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products and corn

loans.name: Zilse Medrano Ospino

texts.es: Zilse de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 a 5 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en adultos exitosos, por ellos se esfuerza día a día en su trabajo como comerciante, para lograr este propósito. Su primera experiencia comercial la obtuvo hace muchos años, vendiendo mercancías mediante guía especializada de productos o catálogos, sus principales mercancías fueron, cosméticos y perfumes, gradualmente fue agregando ropa y otros productos, los que distribuía entre una clientela que fue consiguiendo poco a poco. Cuando estuvo posicionada con sus compradores y fue identificada por sus vecinos, decidió organizar un punto comercial en su propia casa y su negocio empezó a crecer aun más. Hoy cuenta con una infraestructura surtida de mercancías variadas y una clientela que aumenta su demanda de productos, lo que genera a Zilse un gran desafío, porque su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para atender la demanda del mercado. Esta es la razón para acudir a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías como colonias, suéteres, interiores, papelería, sabanas etc. que aumentarán el surtido y con las cuales responderá a pedidos de sus clientes, haciendo de esta inversión todo un éxito, porque logrará la rotación rápida y el aumento de su capital de trabajo  al recuperar todo el dinero invertido.
texts.en:
Zilse is 30 years old.  She lives in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and two children, ages 1 and 5.  She dreams of seeing her children become successful adults and strives everyday in her work as a merchant in order to achieve this intention.  She gained her first business experience many years ago, selling merchandise through specialized product directories or catalogs.  She mainly sold cosmetics and perfume but gradually added clothing and other products and distributed her merchandise to her gradually growing clientele. Once she was positioned with her customers and identified by her neighbors, she decided to organize a point of sale in her own home and her business began to grow even more.  

Today, she has a building stocked with a variety of merchandise, and a clientele that increases demand for her products.  However, this has created a major challenge for Zilse because her working capital has become insufficient to meet market demand.  This is the reason she has come to Kiva to request her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to purchase merchandise such as cologne, sweaters, undergarments, stationery, sheets, and other items to increase her inventory.  She will be able to fill customer orders and make this investment a complete success because the quick turnover and increase in working capital will enable her to recover all the money invested.  
.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cologne, sweaters, undergarments, stationery, and sheets.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. 
Yolanda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future,Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Romeo has a shop that sells stocks of mini and handy electrical appliances like microwave ovens and rice cookers. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks of mini and handy electrical appliances .
Romeo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of mini and handy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Braulita

texts.en:
Braulita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Braulita has a tailoring shop that sews and sells office and school uniforms, curtains and pillow sheets and bed covers. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy materials needed in the tailoring shop.
Braulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Braulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Arlene is married and has four children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture, making and selling snack goods in the local community. Arlene has been in her business for two years and earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. Arlene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase bananas to sell. In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Gemma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Marietta has a shop that sells generic medicines in tablets and syrups. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks of generic medicines to sell.
Marietta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marietta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of generic medicines to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. She earns a living by running a shop that sells fish, including milk fish, sardines, mackerel and trout. She has had this business for six years, and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy new stocks of fish to sell. Vicenta joined HSPFI last year, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a widow who has three children. She is 55 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Philippines, where she earns a living by owning and operating a coconut plantation. She's been in this business for two years and earns about PHP 3,000 a month. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to plant and raise. This year, Leonora  joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Leonora wants to make improvements of her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bienvenue

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, celibataire avec un enfant, elle se lance dans le commerce quand elle arrête ses etudes en classe de troisième et commença la vente de foufou il y'a bientôt 11 ans.

Elle a deja bénéficié de 3 cycle de prêts,elle a rembourse avec succès ses differents prêts,et a fait des épargnes a tout moment qu'elle remboursait, son activité est très florissante, elle a la capacité de vente de 5 a 10  sacs  de 50 kg par semaine .
A l'octroi de ce nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer son stock en ajoutant 20 sacs de foufou de 50kg , elle choisit toujours la meilleure qualité de foufou pour attirer sa clientèle, et elle a su fidéliser ses clients par la qualité de ses produits.
Elle est très entreprenante, son grand projet est d'ouvrir un dépôt de foufou et aussi faire des livraisons a domicile.
Elle continue a améliorer les conditions de sa vie et assure les etudes de son enfant.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 44-year-old single mother of one child. She started working in small trade after leaving school in the ninth grade, and has been selling foufou (processed root vegetable) for nearly eleven years. 

She previously received three loans, which she repaid successfully. The loans helped her to increase her savings. Her business is booming, as she sells 5 to 10 sacks of 50 kg per week.

She will use her new loan to replenish her stock by buying twenty 50kg sacks of foufou. She always buys the highest quality of foufou as this is how she can attract new customers and ensure their loyalty. 

She has a strong entrepreneurial spirit, and her main goal is to open a foufou storage facility and offer home delivery. She continues to improve her living conditions and provide for her child’s education

loans.use: to buy sacks of processed cassava flour.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.es: Shirly de 24 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo menor de edad, e inició un negocio hace 2 años cuando formalizó su hogar, decorando en pedrería calzado, los cuales compra en el centro de la ciudad, decora y vende entre una clientela que ha ido estructurando gradualmente, entre familiares, vecinos y amigos, que le refieren nuevos clientes. Ella vende de contado y maneja una pequeña cartera de crédito. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia vivienda y por eso todos los días ese esmera en lograr, mediante su trabajo, construir el éxito de su negocio. En la actualidad requiere un capital de trabajo para comprar chancletas, sandalias, suéteres, bermudas y piedras de fantasía con accesorios decorativos que aplicará a todos estos productos para responder a su clientela en crecimiento.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logrará nuevos y creativos diseños,  para impactar su clientela, despertando su atención, interés, deseo y acción de compra, lo que hace que esta inversión se postule como exitosa, por su experiencia en el desarrollo de la técnica y la exclusividad que genera a cada cliente al vestirse con estas prendas.
texts.en:
Shirly, age 24, lives with her husband and her minor child.  When she prepared her home two years ago she started a business of decorating shoes with jewels.  She buys them in the center of the city, decorates them, and sells them.  Her clientele has been gradually building between relatives, neighbors, and friends who refer new customers to her.

She sells for cash, and she handles a small credit portfolio.  Her goal for later on is to have her own house.  In order to do so she tries hard every day to achieve, through her work, the success of her business. 

She currently needs working capital to buy slippers, sandals, sweaters, and bermudas.  She will also buy imitation jewels to use as decorative accessories that she will apply to all of these products in order to respond to her growing clientele.  That is why she turns to a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With the loan she will produce new and creative designs to impact her customers.  She will awaken their attention, interest, and desire.  Then they will buy.  She hypothesizes that this investment will be successful because of her experience in developing the technique and the exclusivity that she generates for each customer upon wearing her goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sandals, sweaters, bermudas, and imitation jewels to make decorative accessories to apply to these items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Mercedes has a shop that makes and sells coconut and wood charcoals per sack. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.
Mercedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mercedes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

loans.name: Phemie

texts.en:
Premie, age 31, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has run this business for two years. She and her husband have two children.

Phemie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

In the future, Phemie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish is 62 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (or Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband is retired. She started her grocery-retailing business in 2001 by renting a counter in a local market. Over the years, she has gained many customers and trusted suppliers. The population in her area is increasing, as is demand for her products. That is why she needs to buy additional supplies to meet her demand. She is requesting a loan for 800,000 MNT to buy fresh vegetables to sell. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is finally picking up and I won't lose this opportunity."

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en: Anabella is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. She has a retail shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and electronic and herbal products. She has had this business for 11 years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional items to sell in her store. Anabella joined HSPFI last year, and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. She has a shop where she sells fish such as sardines, mackerel and trout. She is also raising and selling pigs, and has been in business for nine years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell. She joined HSPFI last year and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rincones Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Rincones del Sur” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de frutas, confección de ropa y cortinaje, la mayoría de ellos trabajan en ferias libres rotativamente. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Ximena presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste un polerón color lila y usa jeans, usa su cabello suelto y éste es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida, generalmente vende empanadas de mariscos. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace dos años, desde su casa y recibe la colaboración de su familia. Trabaja los fines de semana con un horario de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 4ºº de la tarde.
Sus preparaciones las promociona de boca en boca y también con letreros. 
Su mercadería la compra a mayoristas y también en distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará mariscos y embutidos. 
Una de sus metas es habilitar una local al interior de su casa, en la cual pueda trabajar de manera independiente de la cocina de su casa.
Ximena vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es terminar de estudiar la carrera de Educación de Párvulo. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le otorga Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Comenta que siente muy cómoda con las reuniones, ya que el grupo es comprometido y colaborador.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han ayudado a generar nuevas estrategias de venta.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This communal bank called “Rincones del Sur” is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields. These businesses include selling clothing and fruit as well as making clothes and curtains. The majority of the entrepreneurs work at rotating fairs. They all live in the city of Osorno. 
Ximena is president of the communal bank. In this photo, she is seated in the first row, in the first seat going from right to left. She is wearing a lilac colored hoodie and jeans. Her hair is down and it is dark brown.
She makes fast food, mainly seafood empanadas. She has been in this business for two years, working from her home and getting help from her family. She works during the weekends from eight in the morning until four in the evening. 
She advertises her food by word of mouth and also by using signs. 
Her merchandise is bought by wholesalers and distributors. 
With the loan, she will purchase seafood and sausages. 
One of her goals is to set up a business in her home in order to work in an area independent from her home’s kitchen. 
Ximena lives with her husband and their two children who are 14 and 18 years old. One of her dreams, at a personal level, is to finish her early-education degree.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business granted by the Fondo Esperanza. She comments that she feels very comfortable in the meetings since the group is committed and collaborating.
On the subject of trainings, they have helped her to generate new sales strategies. 
Osorno is a city located in the in southern area of Chile, in the region of Los Lagos. This is an important agricultural center known as “The Homeland of Milk and Land of Meat” (La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne) in Chile. 
The agricultural areas that stand out are the cultivation of wheat and oats, raising livestock for meat and dairy processing as well as the manufacturing of farm equipment. 
The only roof-covered soccer stadium in Chile, the "Rubén Marcos” city stadium, is located in Osorno.

loans.use: purchase seafood and sausages.

loans.name: Santos Oswaldo

texts.es:
Santos Oswaldo tiene 56 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la conyugue y los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de café, cacao, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.El sueño e spoder comprar animales para poder críar y tener otros ingresos adicionales. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar en la casa.
texts.en:
Santos Oswaldo, age 56, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  He lives with his wife and his children in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  He is a member of the 25 de Febrero communal bank, which is in the Guabito precint, Zapotal parish, Ventanas canton.  They devote themselves to agricultural work.

Santos grows cacao, coffee, and oranges.  He is requesting the loan to buy coffee and cacao plants, chemical and natural fertilizers, urea, and insecticides.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizers for the crops.

He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to buy animals in order to raise them and have additional income.

In his free time he likes to rest at home.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cacao plants, chemical and natural fertilizers, urea, and insecticides.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, age 51, is a farmer living in in Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is married and has five children.

Rebecca used her last loan to purchase fertilizers. Her business grew and became more successful as a result. She is now taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

She is positive about the future of her business and hopes to be able to further expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu, age 46, lives with his wife and six children in a "ger" (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. He started his meat retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter at market. Over the years he has gained many suppliers and regular customers. His wife helps with his business, their elder child is a college student, and the rest of the children are enrolled in school and kindergarten.

At present, Naranhuu's suppliers are increasing their prices rapidly. For this reason, he needs to travel through rural areas in order to buy a bulk quantity of meat. He is requesting a 3,700,000 MNT loan to this end. 

He is a sharp and hard-working man. He reports, "My income is decreasing and I need to act aggressively in order to support my family."

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Angel Teodoro

texts.es:
Angel Teodoro tiene 64 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la conyugue y los hijos en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, banano. Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de cacao, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para poner en los cultivos de cacao y banano.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar tierras para sembrar 
más caco.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Angel Teodoro is 64 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  He has three children and lives with his spouse and the children in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of 25 de Febrero Communal Bank, located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas, where they work in agriculture.

Angel works in agriculture growing cacao and banana trees.  He is requesting the loan to buy cacao plants, fertilizer, and manure.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the manure to put on the cacao and banana crops.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.

His dream is to be able to buy lands to plant more cacao.  In his free time he likes to help make repairs to the house.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants, fertilizer, and manure.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas provides house construction services to local residents of his community. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes himself as being ambitious. He is unmarried and has no children as yet. His business is located in a lucrative environment. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high costs of materials for construction. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more building materials for house construction. 

Dismas's dream and business goal is to own a construction services company within five years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 45, runs a retail store where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She and her husband have two children. 

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
 
In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 45, has a shop that sells vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, and potatoes per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She is married with four children. 

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to offer for sale.

In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Analie has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Analie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is from Caniangan, Tangub City. She is 68 years old and married. Natividad has had a banana plantation for five years and earns 8,000 PHP per month from it. In 2010, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. Natividad is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Khatanbaatar Tumurchudur

texts.en: Khatanbaatar, 23, runs a taxi service, and his wife and her sister run a small grocery store together as a family business. He lives with his wife in a rental apartment in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Khatanbaatar and his wife want to increase the working capital of their grocery store in order to expand the business. It will increase the store’s sales volume as well as the family's income. He first needs to purchase commodities in  large amounts from the big food markets in the city. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to increasing the business's working capital.

loans.use: to purchase commodities in bulk for his family's grocery business.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province. Her husband is employed and her son is three months old. She started her garment retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the biggest market in the province. Her products are very eye-catching, and she sells them at fairly cheap prices. Her income is increasing rapidly so she has decided to rent another counter in the market. She has already found the spot; however, she needs support to stock the counter. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more summer garments to sell. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Since my income is the main income in the family, I will do everything I can to support my family."

loans.use: to buy more summer garments to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as salt, flour, sugar, tea leaves, steel wool, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of home products. She will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Jane's dream and  business goal is to expand her retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 33 years old and married with two children. Arturo used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to purchase additional fertilizer. In the future he hopes to be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is married with three children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. Amalia earns a living by providing transportation services to local community members. She's been doing this for 26 years, and every month she earns PHP 6,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to repair a vehicle used in the transport business. In 2007, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Amalia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transport business

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Baasankhuu, 26, drives a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his son, 2, in his parents-in-law’s house. Recently he purchased a small plot of land in the suburban district of the city. He is grateful for his family, because now they can move out of their parents' home and live by themselves. Baasankhuu is planning to start building his new house but he has some financial difficulties – especially purchasing some expensive building materials on the market. One of his friends, who has his own building material supply business, recommended he purchase things below the market price. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to the purchase of necessary building materials for his new house.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for building his new house.

loans.name: Hishigsuren

texts.en: Hishigsuren is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, while their elder child is a student and the younger one stays at home. She started her fruit retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Her income is stable; however, it is not enough to support her whole family. Therefore, she has decided to rent another space. She is requesting 500,000 MNT to rent a new counter in the market.

loans.use: to rent a new counter in the market

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is a single woman.She has no children yet. She describes herself as ambitious. She provides hair services and sells home products. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a conducive environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of home products. She will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products for her retail shop. Anastacia's dream and business goal is to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 49, has a direct-selling business. She lives in Bacoor, Cavite City, with her husband Edwin, a laborer, and their three children. The couple manages the family household while operating their businesses.

Nancy works hard in her direct sales business to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then the item is given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Nancy's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nancy hopes to have another branch in the coming years and dreams of ensuring that her children will receive a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, age 49, is a corn farmer. She is widowed and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her three children. To make a living, Catalina plants and harvests corn,  which she then offers for sale. Catalina has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maynor Francisco

texts.es:
Maynor Francisco tiene 18 años de edad, esta casado y vive en el Municipio de Morazán, Yoro.   
Maynor es un joven muy emprendedor que se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de arroz.  Se independizo hace 3 años con el objetivo de hacer bienes propios.  Obteniendo la experiencia por medio de su padre. Tiene cultivada 1 manzana de arroz que comercializa en los molinos de la ciudad ya que es un producto de primera calidad y las ganancias que el obtiene de la venta son rentables. 
Con el financiamiento de 6,000 lempiras que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante, insumos y mano de obra que el cultivo requiera. Para sacar un buena cosecha y seguir vendiendo a los molinos obteniendo mejor porcentaje de ganancias.
Para el futuro el piensa aumentar su cosecha, y brindar siempre el mantenimiento completo a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Maynor Francisco, 18, is married and lives in the Municipality of Morazán, Yoro.  Maynor is an enterprising young man who is a farmer, specifically growing rice.  He became independent three years ago with the objective of creating his own assets.  He gained experience through his father.  He has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] planted that he sells to mills in the city since it’s a product of fine quality and the earnings he earns through the sale are profitable.

With the 6000 lempira loan he’s asking for he will buy fertilizer, supplies and pay labor costs to do required crop tasks in order to product a good harvest and continue selling to the mills obtaining better profit margins.  In the future, he’s planning to increase his harvest and always provide complete maintenance to his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and to pay labor costs for crop maintenance.

loans.name: María Virginia Morán

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 61 años, que vive sola en la parroquia de "Río Verde" en Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre regiones. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por sus paisajes. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

María inició su negocio hace 13 años. Tiene un bazar donde comercia varios productos como lo son: juguetes, cosméticos, regalos, productos para el hogar, etc. Este negocio fue una iniciativa de su hija como nos comenta. Esta mujer desea hacer una inversión en mercadería aprovechando la época de "Carnaval" en la cual las ventas de su mercadería es alta. Este es su segundo crédito, siendo el primero hace dos años atrás el cual pago puntualmente todas sus cuotas. 

María nos comenta que le gusta la atención que recibe de su asesor de crédito, que pertenece a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entra KIVA y María. De esta institución recibe además la oportunidad de tener capacitación y asesoramiento, de tal manera que María pueda invertir de la mejor manera los recursos recibidos y crecer de manera sustentable.
texts.en:
María, 61, lives alone in the "Rio Verde" parish in Santo Domingo, which is one of the youngest cities in Ecuador and currently the connecting point between regions.  It is a privileged location, not only for its rich ethnicity, but also because of its landscape.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados now belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas which was formed in 2007.  The main festivities of Santo Domingo are celebrated with intense comings and goings of visitors, as well as commercial and cultural exchanges.  A great trade fair is held in the Farmers' Association facilities, where show and competition of the best specimens of the different breeds and crossbreeds raised in the region's haciendas take place.

María started her business 13 years ago at the initiative of her daughter.  She has a bazaar where she sells different products such as toys, cosmetics, gifts, home products, etc.  This lady wants to invest in merchandise to take advantage of the "Carnival" season, which is when sales reach their highest volume.  This is her second loan.  She took out the first loan two years ago and paid it back on time.

María says she likes the attention she receives from the credit counselor at the Fundación Alternativa, which is the intermediary between KIVA and María.  From this institution she is able to receive training and counseling, enabling María to invest the resources she receives in the best way possible for sustainable growth.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 36, has a direct sales business. She lives in Bacoor, Cavite City, with her husband Arceo, who is a laborer, and their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their businesses. 

Erlinda is working hard in her direct sales business to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and the item is then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of providing all her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melecio Jr.

texts.en:
Melecio Jr. is married. He is 33 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Melecio Jr. runs a general store selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 12 years and every month he earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. He has requested a loan of 6,600 PHP to purchase additional products such as shampoo, liquor and milk to sell.

In 2011, Melecio Jr. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Melecio Jr. hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as shampoo, liquor and milk to sell

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Nuestra Esperanza está conformado por 8 emprendedoras luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo han creado una herramienta de trabajo para salir adelante junto con su familia. Este grupo de emprendedoras ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, ya tiene un ciclo en el cual han demostrado ser responsable y con un record crediticio intachable, las emprendedoras nos expresan que han aumentado sus mercaderías y que sus clientes de igual manera, están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que se les ha brindado. Yadira es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo de emprendedoras, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de comida la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes, está solicitando financiamiento para la compras de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, bolsas, leña  entre otros productos que requiere para la elaboración de la comida.
texts.en:
The communal bank NUESTRA ESPERANZA is comprised of eight enterprising women who, through much effort, have created a working tool in order to support their families.  This group of entrepreneurs has been working with the Fundación León 2000; and in their first cycle have proven themselves to be responsible, with a perfect credit record.  They claim to have increased their merchandise inventory and customers, and are grateful for the support they have received.  

Yadira is a member of the group and she sells food out of her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, vegetables, bags, firewood and other products she needs to prepare food.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, bags, firewood and other products to make food.

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señorita. Lorena es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, viven por la parroquia de Sinincay en Cuenca, lugar que cuenta con  hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, muchos laboran en varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

La Señorita Lorena tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, la casa en donde viven es propia.
 
Ella  trabaja en su casa tejiendo bufandas y carteras, actividad que aprendió en cursos y se encuentre en este negocio hace 4 meses, también le ayuda a su mamá en los quehaceres de la casa. También cría cerdos, pollos, cuyes y patos a los que los venden en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hilos para su negocio y alimento para los animales.
 
Su meta es comprarse una máquina para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena is a member of the communal bank LA ESQUINA.  She lives in the Sinincay Parish in Cuenca, a beautiful place to visit where the local people are involved in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  Many people also work in different businesses in the city of Cuenca.

Lorena is 21, single and lives with her parents.  Her father works as a bricklayer in the construction industry and her mother is a homemaker, and they live in their own home.

She works at home knitting scarves and bags, which she learned how to do in courses.  She has been in business for four months and also helps her mother with the housework.  She also raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and ducks which she sells in her community.

This is her fourth loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy yarn for her business and animal feed.

Her goal is to buy a machine to increase production.

loans.use: To buy yarn and animal feed.

loans.name: Karen Karlen

texts.es:
KAREN KARLEN tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC Cristo es Poder, se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la oficina  pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, se dedican a labores comerciales minoristas.

 KAREN KARLEN se dedica a la venta de zapatillas de hombres y mujeres. Solicita el crédito para comprar zapatillas blancas y de colores para niñas y niños.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hace para poder vender.

Las compras lo hace en Ventanas cada mes y las ventas lo hace todos los días si hay cómo.

El sueño es poder tener un negocio con diversidad de calzado.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los ingresos para la familia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia y escuchar música religiosa.
texts.en:
Karen Karlen is a 19 year old single woman with no children. She lives with her parents in Ventanas, in the Ríos Province. She is a member of the group VRC Cristo es Poder and lives 10 minutes from the office in the county of Ventanas. 

Karen Karlen works in retail selling men's and women's sneakers. She is requesting this loan to purchase children's sneakers in a variety of colors. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the goods that she very much needs in order to sell. 
 
Karen Karlen makes her purchases in Ventanas every month and sells every day when possible. Her dream is to have a variety of shoes in her business. Generating income for her family is one of the challenges she faces. In her spare time she likes to read the Bible and listen to religious music.

loans.use: to purchase children's sneakers in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Laura Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, viven por la parroquia de Sinincay en Cuenca,  lugar que cuenta con  hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, muchos laboran en varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 13, 10 y 2 años de edad, 2 estudian en el colegio y 1 en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Laura nos comenta que en su salud está bien recuperándose de una operación que se ha realizado hace un mes, su familia se encuentra muy bien en la salud.
 
Ella pasa el mayor de su tiempo en casa en donde se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos y ganado, actividad que la desempeña hace 15 años la misma que le ha permitido solventar las necesidades de su hogar y cuidar de su familia.
 
Su crédito anterior lo ha invertido comprando comida de animales, en el pago de su crédito no ha tenido dificultad por lo que ha realizado los pagos a la fecha. Está pidiendo un nuevo crédito ya que quiere  comprar pollos y ganado para continuar con el negocio. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo del grupo y el beneficio del crédito en sus negocios.

Su meta es comprar potreros para criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the “La Esquina” (The Corner) communal bank.  She lives in Sinincay Parish in Cuenca, a place with beautiful places to visit.  Its residents farm, raise livestock and are merchants.  Many are employed in various jobs in the city of Cuenca.

Laura is 34 years old, married and has four children who are 14, 13, 10 and 2 years old.  Two of them attend secondary school and one goes to the local little elementary school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer in construction.  They own the house they live in.

Laura told us that her health is improving from surgery she had a month ago; the family is all in good health.

She spends most of her time at home where she raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens and cattle, an activity she’s been doing for 15 years and that has allowed her to cover her household needs and care for her family.

She used her previous loan to buy animal feed.  She’s had no problems repaying the loan and has made her payments to date.  She is asking for a new loan because she wants to buy chicks and cattle to continue with her business.  

She likes the communal bank because of the companionship within the group and the because of the credit benefits for their businesses.  Her goal is to buy pasture land to raise more cattle.

loans.use: to buy chicks and cattle.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
Elvira Rosa tiene 43 años de edad  es soltera no tiene hijos, vive sola en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cristo es Poder, se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la oficina  pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, se dedican a labores comerciales minoristas.

Elvira se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas y caballeros. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar rora de niñas y niños como calentadores, interiores, blusas, camisetas, medias. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que le hacía tanta falta.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días. El sueño es poder  agrandar el negocio de ropa.
En el tiempo libre arreglar la ropa.
texts.en:
Elvira Rosa, 43, is single, has no children and lives alone in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank CRISTO ES PODER, which is 10 minutes from the office in the Ventanas Canton and whose members are homemakers and retail merchants.

Elvira sells women's and men's clothing.  She is requesting a loan to buy children's clothing such as sweatshirts, underwear, blouses, t-shirts and stockings.  With the loan she plans to buy the merchandise she needs.

She buys and sells goods every two weeks in Ventanas.  Her dream is to expand her clothing business.  In her free time she also does clothing alterations.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing such as sweatshirts, underwear, blouses, t-shirts and stockings.

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza natural y arquitectónica, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, su gente tiene un gran carisma y un corazón cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 24, 20 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la atención de un almacén de artículos para vehículos, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Rosa trabaja con su esposo en la atención de su almacén, venden artículos para vehículos, llevan 20 años en el negocio y trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  mercadería como faros, forros de asientos, alarmas, stikers, radios, etc.  para su negocio.
 
Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “El Arenal” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that’s noted for its natural and architectural beauty.  Since December, 1999, it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  It is the country’s third most important city economically.  Its residents are very charismatic and warmhearted; they preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Rosa is 50 years old, married and has three children who are 24, 20 and 8 years old.  Her first two children work and help her out economically; her youngest daughter attends a little elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in a car parts store.  They do not own a house; they rent.

Rosa works with her husband tending to his store.  They sell items for cars.  They’ve been in business 20 years and work Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.

They’ve been in the communal bank for two years and will use the loan to buy merchandise like headlamps, seat covers, alarms, stickers, radios, etc. for their business.  Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy headlamps, seat covers, alarms, stickers, radios, etc.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza natural y arquitectónica, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, su gente tienen un gran carisma y un corazón cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 47 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 25, 21 y 20 años de edad, su primera y última hija son casadas y vive independientemente, su segundo hijo estudia en una Universidad de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión profesor siendo Lic. Psicólogo Educativo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora María  tiene un restaurante hace 8 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que realiza desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas.

En el banco comunal es socia hace un año. Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando una parrilla de fogón para implementar el negocio de carnes asadas.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “El Arenal” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that’s noted for its architectural and natural beauty; it’s been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since December, 1999, and it’s the country’s third most important city economically.  Its residents are very charismatic and warmhearted; they preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 47 years old, married and has three children who are 25, 21 and 20 years old.  Her oldest and youngest daughters are married and live independently.  Her middle son attends a University in the city.  Her husband is a professor; his degree is in Educational Psychology.  They do not own a house; they rent.

María has had a restaurant for 8 years.  She works Sunday to Sunday from 6 in the morning until 9 at night since she cooks breakfasts, lunches and dinners.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for a year.  She will use her loan to buy a grill for the stove so that she can start selling grilled meats.  Her goal is to finish her house that’s already under construction.

loans.use: to buy a grill for the stove.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica García Alvarado es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos. Tiene domicilio en el Caserío CP-2 de la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Sólo cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad que realiza Angélica consiste en la venta de productos Omnilife, en su domicilio o recorriendo zonas de caseríos aledaños y ya cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona desde hace 6 años. Aparte de esa actividad, también se dedica al cultivo de limón para su comercialización en un terreno equivalente a 0.7 ha que su padre le ha dejado como herencia.
El monto del crédito solicitado asciende a 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán en la adquisición de nuevos productos para agrandar su inventario, y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, trabajan juntos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Angélica García Alvarado is 33, married, and has 3 children.  She lives in the rural CP-2 settlement in the Tambogrande district.  In her home, the only utility is electricity.

Angélica has a business selling Omnilife products which she sells in her home, and also by going around the neighboring settlements.  She has already had an established customer base in the area for 6 years.  In addition to this business, she cultivates lemons to sell on a 0.7 hectare plot of land that her father had left her as an inheritance.

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy new products to increase her inventory, and in this way improve her quality of life.  She works along with her husband to pay for the necessities of the home.

loans.use: to buy more products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa, 23, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been a farm worker for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed in a factory and earns approximately USD 6 per day. Currently, she has two hectares of farmland. In order to grow agricultural crops on this farmland, Channa is requesting a loan of USD 600 to hire a farm worker to clear the jungle on the land. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and help her child get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to hire a farm worker to clear their land

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, 61, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He has been running a barber shop for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His wife is a homemaker. Two of his children are barbers and another one is a lottery seller. They earn approximately USD 15 per day. Due to the difficulty of transporting the family, Heng is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable him save money on his transportation expenses, and the savings could then be used to support the family. In the future, he would like to run another barber shop with his children and rebuild his present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide more convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, viven por la parroquia de Miraflores en Cuenca, lugar que cuenta con  hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, muchos laboran en varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, uno es casado e independiente y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa nos comenta que se encuentra recuperándose satisfactoriamente de una operación que se ha realizado hace 6 meses, su familia se encuentra muy bien en la salud.
 
Ella se dedica a la atención de una tienda de abarrotes, actividad que la desempeña hace 10 años y también se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, ha escogido este trabajo porque le permite pasar en casa al cuidado de su familia, es un trabajo independiente y puede aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de productos  para su tienda y en pollos, en el pago de su crédito se atrasado un poco debido a su operación pero ya se igualo y realizo la cancelación total a la fecha. Con este nuevo crédito va comprar  pollos y más productos de primera necesidad para su tienda ya que le está yendo muy bien en sus negocios. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que comparte con todas las socias y la atención que reciben de parte del promotor de crédito.
 
Su meta es crecer y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the communal bank LA ESQUINA.  She lives in the Miraflores Parish in Cuenca, which has beautiful places to visit and whose people are involved in agriculure, livestock farming and commerce.  Many local people work in different businesses in the city of Cuenca.

Rosa, 60, is married and has two adult children, one of whom is married and independent.  Her single daughter works and helps out economically.  Her husband is a wage-earner and they own the house they live in.

Rosa says she is recovering satisfactorily from an operation she had six months ago and her family is healthy.

She has been running a grocery store for ten years and also raises and sells chickens.  Her independent work allows her to spend time at home taking care of the family, and also provides an income for the household.

She used the previous loan to buy products for her store and chickens.  She fell behind on some of the loan payments due to the operation, but she was able to catch up and paid it off on time.  She plans to use the new loan to buy chickens and more essential goods for the store since business is going very well.  She likes the communal bank because of the fellowship and attention she receives from her loan counselor.

Her goal is to grow and expand her store.

loans.use: To buy chickens and essential goods.

loans.name: Luis Fabian

texts.es:
Luis es una persona de 51 años, se considera una persona alegre, trabajadora. Luis vive con sus padres en la ciudad de ambato provincia del Tungurahua.

Luis trabaja solo en la siembra y cosecha de papas, trabajo que le permite ayudar con los gastos de su hogar. Es el segundo crédito que realiza a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de abonos y fungicidas para el sembrío de papas para que no se dañe y no obtener pérdidas.

Luis sueña con seguir trabajando para sus padres y que Fodemi le siga ayudando.
texts.en:
Luis is a 51 years old person who considers himself to be cheerful and hardworking.  Luis lives with his parents in the city of Ambato, Tungurahua Province.  Luis works alone farming and harvesting potatoes, a job that makes it possible for him to help with his household expenses.  

This is his second loan with Fodemi and it will be used to buy manure and fungicide for his potato crop so that it will not be harmed and he’ll have no losses.  Luis dreams with continuing to work for his parents and that Fodemi will continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide for his potato crops.

loans.name: Matilde Maria

texts.es:
MATILDE MARIA tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive  con el conyugue y con los hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 9 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cristo es Poder, se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la oficina  pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, se dedican a labores comerciales minoristas.

MATILDE MARIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además a la cría de gallinas, tiene una mini tienda de víveres.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquido para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos para loa cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en ventanas cada 8 días. El sueño es poder tener un negocio para tener otro ingreso y poder ayudar a los hijos parta el colegio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasar.
texts.en:
Matilde María, 37, lives with her spouse and four children.  She lives with her spouse and children who are 17, 15, 13 and 9 years old in Ventanas Province, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Cristo es Poder” (Christ is Power) communal bank located ten minutes from the office.  It belongs to Ventanas Canton and they are retail merchants.

Matilde María farms corn and also raises chickens; she has a small grocery store.  She requests the loan to buy seed, fertilizer, urea and weed killing liquid.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy supplies for her crops.

Her purchases and sales will take place in Ventanas every 8 days.  Her dream is to be able to have a business and to have another source of income to help her children with school.  In her free time she enjoys going out on excursions.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, urea and weed killing liquid.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana, tiene 35 años, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos. Ella forma parte del grupo "San José", integrado por 8 personas, vecinos del distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Juana viene trabajando desde hace medio año en la venta de golosinas, negocio que le ha ayudado a afrontar los gastos necesarios para mantener a sus hijos, ya que luego de la pérdida de su esposo se vió en la necesidad de trabajar y encontrar una forma de obtener ingresos económicos que pudieran cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, para aumentar su mercadería y tener variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, is a widow; she has three children.  She’s part of the “San José” group which has 8 members who are all neighbors from Comas District.

Juana has been working selling snacks for the last half year, a business that’s helped her cover expenses needed to support her children since after the loss of her husband she had to work and find a way of earning income to cover her children’s costs.  The loan she got will be used to buy snacks to increase merchandise and have a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy snacks to increase inventory.

loans.name: Senda De Amor Group

texts.es: Irma Eloidina, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Senda de Amor, tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica al destazo de cerdos y agricultura, reside en la comunidad de San Nicolás, del municipio de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. Desde muy joven Irma inicio con una pulpería y hace dos años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y a la venta de cosméticos, ella es una persona muy luchadora y conocida en la comunidad. Su familia es de muy escasos recursos económicos y por tanto cada vez que se les presenta una oportunidad de negocio no la desaprovecha. Así que el préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de pan como ser: harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, cosméticos, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Irma podrá continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, una de sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio. Irma tiene siete ciclos de ser clienta de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Irma Eloidina, a member of the Grupo Solidario Senda de Amor, is 64 years old, is married, and has 4 children.  Her husband works cutting up pigs and farming.  She lives in the community of San Nicolas, in the municipality of Juticalpa, department of Olancho.  When she was very young Irma began with a grocery store, and for two years she has worked making and selling bread and selling cosmetics.  She is a fighter, and a person who is well known in her community.  Her family has very few economic resources but whenever they are presented with a business opportunity they do not waste it.  The loan she is requesting is needed to buy raw materials to make bread, such as flour, eggs, sugar, butter, as well as cosmetics and other things.  With the support of this loan Irma can continue with her business and improve her living conditions.  One of her goals is to grow her business.  Irma has been a client of FAMA for seven cycles and has made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, cosmetics and other things.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada y con un hijo a su cargo. Su domicilio está ubicado en el sector Mayta Cápac, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, domicilio que no cuenta con los servicios básicos.
Juana tiene una bodega en su domicilio, la cual distribuye a las personas y clientes de la zona abarrotes como el arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras y productos de primera necesidad. Otra de las actividades que realiza es la crianza de ovinos y aves de corral. Su cónyuge cuenta con parcelas propias, las cuales siembra con limón, que posteriormente cosecha y comercializa, apoyando de esta manera las actividades de la clienta.
Actualmente, los abarrotes no son suficientes para seguir con el negocio, por lo que Juana a acudido a solicitar un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles, cuya finalidad será la adquisición de abarrotes para el abastecimiento de su bodega.
texts.en:
Juana, 47, is married and has one child in her care.  Her home is located in the Mayta Capac neighborhood, in a rural area of the Tambogrande district.  Her house does not have basic utilities (such as electricity or water).

Juana has a store in her house, where she sells grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk, beans and other basic necessities to the people in her neighborhood.  In addition, she raises sheep and poultry.  Her husband also supports her activities by cultivating lemons that he later harvests and sells on some parcels of land that he owns.

At this time, Juana lacks sufficient groceries to carry on with her business, and so she has come to request a loan of 700 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy groceries to stock up her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: On

texts.en: On, 45, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Two of her children are employed as construction workers. They earn approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, On is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and help her children get their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en: Venancia is married with two children. She is 58 years of age and resides in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Venancia used her last loan to purchase fertilizers. Her business has grown and become more successful. She's now requesting a new loan to purchase more plant seed to raise. She hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plant seeds

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is from Monte Alegri, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old. Lorna is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, producing bananas and coconuts. Lorna has been in her business for four years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado y con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el caserío CP-10, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, casa que cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad a la que se dedica Wilfredo es a la agricultura, puesto que cuenta con 1 ha de cultivos, entre limón y mango, siendo el primero cosechado semanalmente. A parte se dedica a la comercialización de ganado menor el cual, alcanzado su peso y talla ideal, los lleva a vender en el mercado local.
El monto del préstamo asciende a 800 soles y se destinará a la compra de fertilizantes para los cultivos de limón y para el mantenimiento de su ganado.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is thirty-seven years old, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home in the country house CP-10 in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, a house that has electric service.
Wilfred is a farmer, and he possesses one hectare [approximately 2.5 acres] of crops. He cultivates limes and mangos. He harvests the limes weekly. Additionally, he sells smaller livestock [sheep, goats, and pigs] once they have reached ideal size and weight in the local market.
The amount of the loan is 800 PEN [$300] and will be used to purchase fertilizers for his lime crop and to care for his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase materials to care for his crops.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, age 34, operates a variety store in Dasmariñas, Cavite. She is a single parent and has three children. She and her children manage the family household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She expects her business to grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to provide her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Dieu Seul Suffit Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU SEUL SUFFIT est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Akuyo Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Akuyo Rose est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Malik.
