Her dreams are to purchase more merchandise for her retail shop and to diversify the business. Edreda needs this loan to purchase merchandise like tealeaves and washing detergents for  selling.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like tea leaves and washing detergents for selling

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Basilia; continua trabajando con la agricultura  y tambien  criando animales menores; la socia esta saliendo adelante razon por la cual desea seguir invirtiendo su prestamo en la compra d enaimales como una vaca y en la cosecha de suys productos agricolas.
texts.en: This member is called Basilia. She still works in agriculture and she also breeds small animals. She is doing well, so wants to continue to invest her loan in buying animals (such as a cow) and in harvesting her crops.

loans.use: invest in her business by buying a cow and harvesting her crops.

loans.name: Alpha Turay

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo is Alpha, a grocery shop owner in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. Alpha has been a businessman for many years now. A native of Lungi town in Northern Sierra Leone, Alpha is aged thirty-two. He is married to a trader and the couple have two children together. Alpha has requested this loan in order to invest in his business. He will use this loan to buy items like drinks, butter, margarine, mayonnaise, toothpastes, toothbrushes, and soaps at wholesale to add to his bushiness.

loans.use: to buy items at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a thirty-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he started two years ago. He started this business using personal savings. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dreams are to educate his children, diversify his business, and move the business to a more permanent location. Anthony needs this loan to buy soda, beer, and cartons of water.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and cartons of water

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport, where he has worked for over eight years. He started his business through first farming. His major challenge is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dreams are to educate his children and move the business to a more permanent location. Innocent needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Avelina; continua con la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos los cuales los vende, a la socia le ha ido muy bien y le hace sentir feliz el estar en actividad; la socia en esta ocasion desea continuar con este pequeño negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como comprar gallinas y chanchos.
texts.en: The member is Avelina; she continues to raise small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, which she sells. The member has done well and is happy doing this work. At this time, she wants to continue this small business. The member is requesting the loan to buy small animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Rosendo; continua como maestro constructor y sigue trabajando en todas las obras que se le presente; el socio no pudo comprar la maquina mezcladora pero lo hara ahora ya que pago la primera parte y la otra utilizo para sembrar unos terrenos familiares y le ha ido bien, ahora el socio desea poder invertir en la ultima cuota para pagar su maquina mezcladora y de este modo hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en: The member requesting the loan is called Rosendo. He is still a master builder and he still works on all building projects that come up. He was not able to buy a cement mixer for some time, but he will be able to purchase it now. He has already paid the first instalment. He used the rest of his money to sow land belonging to his family. Everything has gone well so far. Now he would like to be able to pay the final instalment for the cement mixer and in this way fulfil his dream.

loans.use: invest in a cement mixer.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: This is sixty-year-old Albert. Born in Bo City, in Southern Sierra Leone, Albert is a husband and father of five grown-up children. He is married to a trader. Albert has been a building contractor for many years now. He wants a loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy building materials like cement, sand, and iron-corrugated zincs at wholesale. He will then retail it himself whenever he has a building contract.

loans.use: to buy building materials at wholesale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be honest and determined in her work. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be restrictions by government authorities to cut trees, leading to shortage of firewood for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more firewood for selling. She hopes and dreams to venture in to a hotel business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for selling

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Philip is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged eight and ten years. He owns a motorbike transport business, a business he started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,500. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 5,000 to repair and maintain his motorbike. The anticipated profit will help him expand the business.

He dreams of being successful in his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike

loans.name: Humu

texts.en: Humu (in the photo) is 32 years old. She was born in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone, and has one child. Her husband is a miner and her child is attending primary school. For 20 years, Humu has been selling dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. retail. She is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Arzu

texts.ru: Arzu 44 let, ona zamujem, u nee 2 detey. Arzu nachala svoy biznes 13 let nazad, sfera ee biznesa eto prodaja jenskoy odejdi. Muj Arzu  rabotaet masterom i iz sovmestnogo daxoda oni planiruyut postroit dom dla sina.  Segodna dengi nujni Arzu dla togo chtobi kupit novie veshi I postavit na prodaju. Dla etogo dela ona xochet 1600 AZN. Pokupateli Arzu ochen dovolni I otzivayutsa o ney kak o dobroporadochnoy I chestnoy jenshine.
texts.en: Arzu is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Arzu started her business of selling women's clothes 13 years ago.  Arzu's husband is a craftsman and out of their combined income, they plan to build a house for their son.   At the present time, Arzu needs money in order to buy new things to sell.  For these purchases, she would like 1,600 AZN.  Arzu's customers are very satisfied and think of her as a scrupulous and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Abelinaa; lcontinua trabajando con la agricultura  y también tiene animales menores, como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas,  y tambien la socia continua con su tienda de abarrotes. a la socia le a ido muy bien y ahora desea poder implementar su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual desea el credito y poder comprar arroz, azucar, fideos, leche entre otros.
texts.en: The member is Mrs. Abelina. She continues farming and also has small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep. She is also continuing with her general store. It has gone very well for her, and now she wants to be able to improve her general store. She wants the loan to be able to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to improve her general store

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; continua trabajando con la agricultura  y también en artesanía la socia compra textiles y los lleva  a vender al poblado de Corao.  La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de textiles y artesanía asi mejorar economicamente, la socia compra lanas de alpaca entre otras y hace chompas tambiena mano; la socia sabe que el turismo se incrementara desde el mes de abril asi que desea estar preparada para cubrir la demanda.
texts.en: The member is Purificacion; she works in agriculture and also in handicrafts. The member buys textiles and takes them to the village of Corao to sell.  The member requests the loan to buy textiles and handicrafts to improve her financial situation. She buys alpaca wool, among others, and also makes sweaters by hand. She knows that tourism increases beginning in April, and she wants to be prepared to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy textiles and wool to sell.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; continua trabajando en la agricultura y en comercio minorista, la socia vende verduras, con el apoyo de su hija; la socia tambien vende animales menores, y mayores. en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de pollos doble pechuga para incrementar sus ventas, a ella le suelen buscar las clientas para comprarle las gallinas doble pechugas.
texts.en: The member requesting the loan is called Ubaldina. She still works in agriculture and retail, selling vegetables with the help of her daughter. She also sells animals, both large and small. This time she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of double breasted chickens, in order to increase her sales. She often has customers coming to her to buy these chickens.

loans.use: purchase double breasted chickens.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

Evangeline operates a grocery stall, where she sells vegetables such as potatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a conducive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables. 

Evangeline's dream and business goal is to be selling the vegetables in wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Consolato

texts.en: Consolato is a married woman. She has a child who is 21 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of charcoal for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Consolato's dream and business goal is to be a charcoal supplier within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling

loans.name: Alhaji Mustapha Kondeh

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Alhaji, a businessman in Makeni. 

Twenty-nine-year-old Alhaji has been a businessman for eight years now. A native of Makeni City, Alhaji is married to a businesswoman. Alhaji sells mobile phones, mobile phone chargers and other mobile phone accessories. He also sells audio and video discs. With the help of this laon, he will expand the size and quality of his business by buying the above mentioned items in larger quantities to add to his kiosk.

loans.use: to buy items to add to his mobile phone kiosk

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: Masika is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 11 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 1 year and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of ingredients for preparing food. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for a room for her restaurant business operation. Her business goal is to venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for a room for her restaurant business operation

loans.name: Garagoz

texts.ru: Garagoz zamujem, u nee troe detey. Ona rabotaet uchitelnicoy v mestnoy shkole i odnovremenno rabotaet kak chastniy repetitor detey. Muj Garagoz takje rabotaet uchitelem. Sfera biznesa yavlaetsa skotovodstvo kotorim ona nachala zanimatsa 6 let nazad. Ona prodayet molochnie produkti v sele gde ona jivet. Ey pomogaet ee semya v etom dele. Garagoz obratilas za dengami v summe 1500 AZN chtobi nachat delat remont doma I pereexat tuda jit.
texts.en: Garagoz is married and has three children.  She works as a teacher in the local school and as a private tutor.  Garagoz's husband is also a teacher.  Garagoz's business is cattle farming, which she took up 6 years ago.  She sells dairy products in the village where they live.  Her family helps her with the business.  Garagoz requested 1,500 AZN in order to begin repairs to their home and to move in to it.

loans.use: to begin home repairs

loans.name: Alberto Nicomedes

texts.es: El cliente, Alberto Nicomedes, es un señor de 54 años de edad, está casado, el cliente trabaja y presta sus servicios en la actividad de construcción en la ciudad de Cochabamba, vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia y de su familia, el cliente vive con su Hija y sus nietos, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la refacción de su vivienda, (techo para tinglado), la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad debilito la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda, esto debido a las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, tal situacion requiere hacer un mantenimiento y el prestamo cubrira este gasto para la familia de Alberto.
texts.en: The borrower, Alberto Nicomedes, is 54 years old. He is married. He works and provides his services in construction in the city of Cochabamba. He lives in the area west of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 10km from the city. The house where he lives belongs to him and his family. He lives with his daughter and his grandchildren. The purpose of the institution's new loan is for the repair of his house (shed roof), which is worn out from the passage of time. The humidity from the constant rains in the city weakened the lower part of the walls of the house. Such a situation requires maintenance work, and the loan will cover this expense for Alberto's family.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 33-year-old business woman who lives in Juba Yei. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 8. Two of them go to school. 

Grace runs a secondhand clothing store business and she has been in the business for 2 years. She has no employees. Grace heard about Finance Sudan through its fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more secondhand clothing and many other items. In addition to this business, Grace has no other source of income.

In 5 years' time, Grace hopes for an increment in the business size and also hopes to build a house. 

Her major challenges include the low income rate and change of the market to a new location. 

Grace says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support and says it’s going to eradicate their poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing and many other items

loans.name: Bible Plus Group

texts.en:
Dorothée is the chairwoman of the group “Bible Plus”, which is made up of 32 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Dorothée sells beverages to the east of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1998. She has worked hard to develop her business. With the high demand of the clients, Dorothée intends with the next loan to buy ten crates of drinks for resale at a profit in order to increase her income. She hopes to generate more profit to support her family. Currently, her business generates US$180 of profit per week. 

Dorothée’s ambition is to open a beverage facility and deliver beverages in her environment. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of eight children whose ages range between 12 and 26 years.

loans.use: to purchase ten crates of drinks in order to reinforce her working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
El señor Mario, tiene 20 Años, vive en el trópico de Cochabamba en la localidad de entre ríos, vive con  su pareja que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva.
El cliente trabaja como ayudante de cerrajería, desde hace un año y es bastante emprendedor, a futuro está pensando tener su propia cerrajera.
El señor Mario nos cuenta que cuando se vino a vivir a esta comunidad la esposa tenía muy poca mercadería de ropa, en los primeros años la señora trabajaba solo como ayudante de venta de ropa nueva, por falta de capital no podía tener su propio negocio, pues poco a poco fue ahorrando y  aprendiendo el negocio del comercio de ropa nueva para posteriormente dedicarse a este rubro, ambos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo. 
Con el transcurso del tiempo fueron  ahorrando poco a poco, con lo cual lograron comprarse  un lote terreno urbano, el destino del crédito es para capital de comercio, con lo cual incrementara y diversificara más su mercadería, y de esa manera sobre salir de esta situación un poco precoz que viven, y posteriormente quiere construir su propia vivienda, para lo cual necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario is 20 years old and lives in Cochabamba, in a town called Entre Ríos. He lives with his wife, who sells new clothing for a living. Mario has worked as a locksmith’s assistant for a year and is quite enterprising. He is thinking about opening his own locksmith business in the future. 

Mario tells us that when he came to live here his wife had very little merchandise. During the first few years she just worked as a clothing sales assistant and wasn’t able to start her own business because she didn’t have the necessary capital. But she saved up gradually and learnt about the clothing retail business so that she could later start a business in this area. Both of them work very hard to provide for their son.  

Over time they have managed to save money and have used it to buy a piece of urban land. The loan will be used as commercial capital to increase and diversify their merchandise. They hope that this will initially improve their situation. Eventually Mario would like to build his own house, so he needs to increase his income.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (new clothing).

loans.name: Famila

texts.ru: Famila 59 letnaya zamujnaya jenshina, u nee 8 detey vozrastov ot 40 do 23. Oni s mujem pensioneri. Sfera ee deyatelnosti yavlayetsa selskoxozaystvo. Vot uje 30 let kak ona derjit korov, prodayet molochnie produkti I masyo. Na segodna u nee 6 korov v stoylo. U nee boleet nevesta I ee budut operirovat’ i poetomu ona obratilas za dengami v 1000 AZN. Famila nadeetsa na ponimanie, jdet pomoshi i blagodarna dobrim ludam.
texts.en:
Famila is a 59 year old married woman with children aged 23 to 40.  She and her husband are retired.  Her line of business is agriculture.  For 30 years now, she has been keeping cows and selling dairy products and meat.  At the present time, she has six cows in the pen.  

Her son's finacee is ill and will be operated on.  Because of this, she has requested 1,000 AZN.  Famila is hoping for your understanding and is depending on your help.  She is grateful to you kind people.

loans.use: to pay for surgery for her daughter-in-law to be

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 42-year-old mother of two from northern Israel. She is a certified nursery school teacher with additional training and certification in young childhood education and care. Safaa manages a daycare and is part of the Social Services Daycare Network. This network ensures Social Services pays tuition of children they sponsor directly to Safaa. In addition, Safaa's daycare enjoys clientele from her neighborhood which is made up of young families. Social Services is now requiring a special reinforced safe room be added to all of their approved daycare centers. Safaa needed this loan to build the reinforced safe room for her daycare facility.

Safaa enjoys the support of her family and wants to continue and see her business provide a warm, loving and positive educational environment for the children in her care. One day she hopes to develop a mother-child center where she will offer children activities and baby massages along with young child education classes for mothers.

loans.use: to build a reinforced safe room for her daycare facility.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a petty trader. She sells vegetables, fish, rice, cooking oil and other food items at Mpohr near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 2 years now. She is single, and she uses her income to pay her accomodation and utility bills. 

Georgina will use her loan to purchase vegetables, bags of rice, boxes of cooking oil, fish and other food items to sell. With the new profits, Georgina will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, bags of rice, boxes of cooking oil, fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi sells frozen chicken. She lives together with her husband and 3 children at Mpohr near Takoradi. Her husband is a farmer. Asi uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. 

Asi will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of frozen chicken to sell. With the new profits she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of frozen chicken to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame operates a grocery shop at Mpohr near  Takoradi.  She has done this for  3 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscute, toffes, powdered milk, etc. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a small scale miner. 

Maame uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the profit, Maame plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alam

texts.ru: Alemu 52, on jenat i u nego 2 detey. On derjit korov, prodayet moloko, sir, maslo u seba doma. Alem soderjivaet svoy biznes okolo 20 let. On obratilsa za dengami v summu 1600 AZN chtobi kupit korovu s telenkom. As s doxoda biznesa on xochet sdelat remont doma.
texts.en: Alam is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  He keeps cows, and sells milk, cheese, and butter from his home.  Alam has had this business for about 20 years.  He has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy a cow and its calf.  He wants to do home repairs with the income from his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and its calf

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida  is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Mpohor near Takoradi, which she has done for 2 years now. Vida is single. She uses her income to  pay her accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery. Vida  hopes to use the profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina use to sell cloth but now sells cooking utensils at Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 2 years now. She is married. Her husband deals in gold and they have 2 children. 

Faustina uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will need a loan to purchase more cooking utensils for sale. With the new profit, Faustina hopes to build a shop to enable her to sell her utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more  cooking utensils for sale.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Vilma del Socorro  reside en el departamento de Granada, desde hace 6 años  comercializa sus productos de artesanía, con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos se encargan de vender ya que el sitio de ventas lo tiene en el parque central de granada, ahí es donde se concentra la mayoría de los turistas que visitan el lugar, comenta que sus ventas son muy buenas por lo que la ciudad es una de las mejores y es la que ofrece mucho turismo por lo tanto  es la mas visitada. 

En esta  temporada   ella tiene más demanda, por este   motivo es que se acerca a Ceprodel  para solicitar  un nuevo crédito, para la compra de  cerámica de barro, de madera, acrílica, billetera de hombre corriente y de cuero, camisetas xerográficas, collares y camas  de madera para niños. Siendo esta mercadería la más comercializada. Y poder así tener una mejor calidad de vida y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma del Socorro lives in Granada department and for the past 6 years has sold handicrafts.  Her children help her  where she has her stall.  It is located in the central park of Granada and that is where most tourists come.  She says that her sales are very good since this city is one of the best with all the attractions offered tourists.

During this season there is a lot of demand. That  is why she is requesting a new loan from Ceprodel so that she can buy ceramic items made of clay, wood, and acrylic, inexpensive and leather men’s wallets, printed t-shirts, necklaces, and wooden cradles. These  are all products that sell the best.  She wants to give her family a better and more comfortable quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic items made of clay, wood, and acrylic, inexpensive and leather men’s wallets, printed t-shirts, necklaces, and wooden cradles

loans.name: Sharmy Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora  Sharmy Rebeca, reside en nandasmo municipio del departamento de Masaya. Ella tiene su negocio desde hace dos  años y medio, su  negocio consiste   en  comercializar el pan  fuera de Masaya, entre ellos Managua y león, al ver que le hiba bien comenzó a llevar productos de artesanía el cual le dio buenos resultados, aparte que en su casa tiene un pequeña venta de refrescos naturales. 

Ella comenta que trata de salir adelante en su negocio, y que busca la manera de mantener siempre su clientas  satisfechos y  también  poder tener una mejor condición de vida con  su familia. Visita Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de bolis, pan, fresquito, cerámica grande y pequeña, jarrones, comedor, jugueteras,  menciona que se ha sentido  apoyada por medio de los financiamientos que ha adquirido con las diferentes instituciones financieras, el cual mantiene un buen récor crediticio.
texts.en:
Sharmy Rebeca lives in the town of Nandasmo in the department of Masaya. She has had her business for two and half years. Her business is selling bread beyond Masaya, for instance in Managua and León. She started also carrying craft products, with good results. She has a small stall for selling natural sodas in her house. 
She says that she tries to be successful in her business and she always looks for ways to keep her clients happy and also to be able to have a better quality of life for her family. She visited Ceprodel to request a loan to buy pens, bread, large and small ceramics, vases, and toys. She says that she has felt supported by the loans that she has had from different institutions and has a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy pens, bread, large and small ceramics, vases, toys.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de la de que algunas personas ya estaban dentro del programa del comité decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad, algunas se habían retirado de otros comités pero con excelentes pagos y muy buena referencias. De esa manera se inicia dicho comité. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa.
La Sra Yeisy tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con el Sr  Gustavo, tienen 5 hijos que van a la escuela, y por quienes esta pareja siempre lucha incansablemente. La Sra. Se dedica a la peluquería, y comenta que sus servicios son muy requeridos, por lo que le va muy bien.
Ella quiere seguís ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes, es por ello que solicita el préstamo, para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para la peluquería, como ser gel, tintes, spray, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, Ella está contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que la ayudara mucho.
texts.en:
The bank was formed because some people that were already in the program decided to form one in their community.  Some had left other banks but with excellent payments and very good references.  The bank began in this way.  Currently the bank is in its second loan cycle in the program.

Yeisy, 29, is married to Gustavo.  They have five children who are in school, and for whom this couple always fights tirelessly.  She works in her beauty salon, and comments that her services are in great demand, so it is going very well for her.

She wants to continue offering good service to her customers.  This is why she is requesting the loan, to be able to buy the necessary supplies for the beauty salon, such as gel, dyes, hairspray, shampoo, rinses, and others.

She is happy about the opportunity she is getting because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, ellas trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2010,  y actualmente se encuentran  en el 6º ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María,  ella se dedica  a la  elaboración de masas dulces en general y tiene una confitería en su domicilio donde vende sus tortas y tartas sobre pedido a también a los clientes que llegan al local.  Ella comenta que le va bien, ya que siempre recibe pedidos y de esa forma puede seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Cuenta la Sra. María  que solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos que utiliza en los dulces que prepara, como ser: azúcar, manteca, colorantes y demás. Ella agradece a la fundación y Kiva por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación came about when one of the members contacted the foundation. They have been working with the foundation since the year 2010 and they are currently in the 6th loan cycle of the program with Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
One of the group members is María. She works making pastries and has a confectionary store in her home where she sells cakes and pies to order and also to people who come to her store. She says things are going well, that she always gets orders and these enable her to keep working and helping her family. 
María says she is requesting the loan to buy supplies that she uses in the pastries that she prepares, such as: sugar, butter, colorings, and more. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy supplies for their confectionary store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres todas vecinas en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Mirta es miembro del gupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien equipada que tiene desde hace ya un tiempo. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido ir creciendo y también gracias a ello dar lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito, ya que quiere surtir con distinto tipos de productos su despensa, como ser harina, fideos, arroz, leche, azúcar, pan y otros. Su deseo es seguir creciendo para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group Virgen del Pilar was born through the management and support of a group of women who are neighbors. The group is from Ciudad de San Lorenzo and the members have made it their main goal for each one of them to grow as a worker and as a person. 
Mirta is a member of the group and she tells us that she is in sales, as she has a grocery store that is well stocked, and that she has had this business for a while. She says that she started with a small store but, thanks to her work and effort, she has been able to grow and so to give the best to her family. 
She is requesting the loan as she wants to stock different types of product in her store, such as flour, noodles, rice, milk, sugar, bread, and more. Her goal is to keep growing to help her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, noodles, rice, milk sugar, bread, and other things for the grocery store.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 10 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité  tiene  experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  son meses   los que trabajan juntas. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de progreso.
Una de las integrantes, Ramona, está acompañada con Roque, cuya actividad es Albañil, tienen 3 hijos todos. Ramona se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza pero que su deseo es poder tener su propio local y así poder ayudarle a su marido a generar ingresos para su hogar, ya que el dinero que gana n no les alcanza para poder empezar con los trabajos que ella desea realizar.
En vistas a cumplir su meta, ella s solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes para los productos de limpieza que ella vende, como ser cloro, colorante, aromas y demás, ya que eso le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 10 members of the city of Encarnación. The committee has experience in teamwork, as it has been months since they started working together. They are very hardworking women and really want to progress in life. 

One of the group members, Ramona, is married to Roque, who is a bricklayer and they have three children together. Ramona sells cleaning products and dreams of having her own store so she would be able to help her husband generate more income for their household. The money they are currently making isn't sufficient to help her start the work she would like to do. 

With her eye on fulfilling her goal, she is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients for the cleaning products she sells such as bleach, coloring, scents, etcetera. This would be a a great help to her.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEGNON  est composé de quatorze personnes qui mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus et habitent le même village. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Amoussou. Micheline est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Micheline a un autre enfant à charge. Micheline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Micheline mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (bananes plantains, escargots) au Bénin. De façon secondaire, Micheline vend des noix de palme. Micheline exerce cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’année et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Micheline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEGNON , un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The DAGBEGNON group consists of fourteen people who are all involved in income-generating activities and live in the same village. It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.  

Micheline, the group's representative, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 54 years old and married to a farmer named Amoussou.  She is the mother of five children who all attend school.  Besides her own children, Micheline has another child in her care.  She lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.
  
To take care of expenses, Micheline sells various items such as plantains and snails, in Benin.  She also sells palm nuts.  Micheline has been involved in this activity for about twenty years and stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to better satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Micheline is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the DAGBEGNON group.

loans.use: to buy snails and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Señor. Alcides tiene 33 años y junto a su padre Mario se dedican a la elaboración y Venta de Baldosas de todo tipo, vive en de la Ciudad de Paraguarí, el está acompañado con la Señora Perla con quien tienen 2 hijos una de 13 años y otra de 7 años.
El Señor Alcides nos cuenta que se unió al negocio de su padre hace aproximadamente 15 años desde que termino la secundaria y que su padre lleva más de 30 años de haber   empezado con la fabricación de Baldosas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cementos, moldes, y demás insumos que necesita para la elaboración de las baldosas. Agradecen por la oportunidad de progreso que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Alcides, 33, and his father Mario work making and selling all types of floor tiles.  He lives in the city of Paraguarí with Perla, with whom he has two children, a 13-year-old daughter and a 7-year-old daughter.

Alcides tells us that he joined his father's business approximately 15 years ago when he finished high school, and that his father began making floor tiles more than 30 years ago.

He is requesting the loan to buy cement, molds, and other supplies he needs to make floor tiles.

They are grateful for the opportunity to progress that they are getting.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make floor tiles.

loans.name: Alicia Nuñez

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia tiene  47 años de edad, estuvo  casada 20 años y por  las cosas de la vida se separo de su marido, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre anciana la Sra. Natividad  a quien le cuida con mucho esmero en su casa de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Sra. Alicia se dedica a la venta de Golosinas al por mayor y menor, también vende comida por vianda, tiene su puesto en el Mercado, hace mas de 14 años. Ella comenta que debe levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana todos los días, para asear su casa y preparar los alimentos y otras necesidades a su madre a quien cuida como mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que es el único familiar que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de caramelos, turrones, chicles, bombones, paletas, chupetines, chocolates, etc., con lo cual podrá surtirse para los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old. She was married for 20 years but, because of the way life goes, she is separated from her husband. She doesn't have children and she lives with her elderly mother, señora. Natividad who she looks after with care in her house in the city of Coronel Oviedo.
Alicia works selling candy in bulk and individually. She also sells food. She has had a stall in the market for more than 14 years. She comments that she has to get up at 4 in the morning every day to clean her house and prepare the food and other necessities for her mother, who she cares for with great affection and dedication as she is the only family that she has. 
She is requesting a loan to buy caramels, nougat, chewing gum, hard candy, lollipops, chocolates, etc, with which to meet her clients orders.

loans.use: to buy caramels, nougats, chewing gum, hard candy, lollipops, chocolates, etc, to sell.

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en: Julliet operates a grocery shop in Mpohr near Takoradi. This she has done for three years now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a software programmer. She uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the profit, Julliet plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mónica Susana

texts.es:
La Señorita Mónica es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeada por abundante vegetación, en donde se puede disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad del campo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señorita. Mónica tiene 20 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño que tiene 6 meses de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es empleado privado y su mamá labora en los quehaceres del hogar, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y vende la cosecha de su trabajo y también compra verduras para vender en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. También cría ganado, conejos, cuyes y cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the community bank 14 de Agosto. She lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place that is surrounded by abundant vegetation, where one can enjoy the peace and tranquility of the countryside. The people there work in agriculture, raise animals, and many work daily in the city at various jobs. 
Mónica is 20 years old and is the single mother of a little boy of 6 months old. She lives in her parents' house and she shares the household expenses with them. Her father is a private employee, and her mother takes care of the home. The house that they live in belongs to her parents. 
She works in agriculture, she grows vegetables and sells the results of her work and she also buys vegetables to sell in the city market. She works Monday to Friday without a fixed timetable. She also raises cattle, rabbits, guinea pigs and pigs. 
This is the third loan she has had from the community bank and she will use it to buy vegetables and animal feed. 
Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and animal food.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a seamstress. She is married to a businessman and has three children. She has been sewing for 10 years now. She uses her income to help her husband pay their accommodation bills. Gifty makes dress for sale, so she needs this loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes to sell. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Alfred from Krootown central area in Freetown. He is single with one child aged 7 years old. Alfred's children attend school. 

Alfred runs a Mobile shop and calling centre at Krootown market. He sells mobile phones, chargers, credit card, DVD plates and CD plates. He has been running this business for 7 years. He works at the business 7 days per week, and 13 hours a day. His other source of income comes from renting out a house. Alfred says that some costumers do not have electricity in their home, when he operates a business of charging phones they do misplace the charging cards.

Alpha has requested a loan in order to buy more mobile phones and DVD plates. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans on owning a mobile factory. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones and DVD plates.

loans.name: Alpha   A

texts.en:
Meet 32 year old Alpha from Lumley in the western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children between the ages of 2 years and 6 years old. One of his children is currently attending school. In 2002, Alpha established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough income to support his family. He works at the business 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital.

Alpha requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetic and medical drugs. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to raise enough profit to train his children. In the future, Alpha plans to open up more branches and employ staff. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic and medical drugs such as syrup, perfume, injection and malarial drugs.

loans.name: Maire

texts.en: This is 31 years old Maria.  She is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 10 yrs old. In 2000, Maria established her commercial business in cottons of different quality. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 658,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Maria requires a loan in order to purchase different types of clothing for her business.  In the future, Maria plans to get more profit and build her own cold room.   She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Eudalda

texts.es:
La sra. Eudalda tiene 68 años, es viuda y todos sus  hijos ya esta casados e independizados. Vive en su modesta casa de la ciudad de Caacupé.
Ella es comerciante desde hace más de 30 años, empezaron con su marido vendiendo primeramente solo bebidas heladas, con el pequeño ahorro y el esfuerzo que los caracterizan lograron formar su pequeña despensa y dedicarse también en la fabricación de maíz molido. Gracias a la buena atención y la buenísima calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene una clientela formada.
La Sra. Eudalda solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz en grano para luego poder procesarlo para la venta. Ña Eudalda desde ya agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza que le otorgan.
texts.en:
Señora Eudalda is 68 years old.  She is a widow and all her children are married and independent. She lives in her modest home in the city of Caacupé.
She has been a merchant for over 30 years.  She began with her husband selling primarily frosted beverages.  With their small savings and the effort that characterize them, they managed to form their small pantry and to be dedicated also to the production of ground corn.  Thanks to their good service and the excellent quality of their products she now has a clientele formed.  
Señora Eudalda requests the loan to purchase corn as grain in order to be able to process it for sale.  Señora Eudalda thanks the Paraguay Fundation and Kiva for the support and the confidence that they have shown her.

loans.use: to buy corn to process it.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet operates a grocery shop at Mpohr near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 years now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. She also cooks yam for sale; she serves it with vegetable sauce.  

She is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband by paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell and yams to cook for sale. With the new profit, Janet plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of groceries to sell and yams to cook for sale.

loans.name: Amour De L’Eternel Group

texts.fr: AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Nina Mathilde (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Nina Mathilde est mariée à un certain Séraphin. Nina Mathilde vit ensemble avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison.  Nina Mathilde a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Nina Mathilde vend depuis cinq ans environs, des friperies à son domicile. Nina Mathilde s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité,  Nina Mathilde sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits obtenus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AMOUR DE L'ETERNEL is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  

The group's representative, Nina Mathilde (raising her hand in the photo) is 40 years old.  She is married to a man named Séraphin and lives with him.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.

Nina Mathilde left school at the secondary level.  In order to cover her various expenses, she has been selling used clothing from her home, for about five years.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to meet her customers' needs and to broaden her activity, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the AMOUR DE L'ETERNEL group.  This loan will enable them to better meet the needs of their customers and get more profits.  Their previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeada por abundante vegetación, en donde se puede disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad del campo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Norma tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija también estudia en la universidad. Su esposo labora como ebanista, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Norma en su salud se encuentra un poco delicada ya que sufre de artritis y está en tratamiento, todos los miembros de su familia se encuentra muy bien en la salud. Ella es auxiliar de servicios de limpieza y trabaja como conserje de un colegio, actividad que la desempeña hace 13 años. También cría animales.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en pollos y alimento, en este negocio le va muy bien  y no tuvo ningún problema al cancelar sus cuotas ya que las realizo en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar ya que va a iniciar este negocio también, este bazar lo va a instalar en su casa, El banco comunal le gusta por el compromiso de las socias en los pagos y el compañerismo ya que en cada reunión conversan de muchos temas.

Su meta es crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the communal bank '14 de Agosto' (14th of August). She lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, it is an area that is surrounded by abundant vegetation where one can enjoy the peace and tranquility of the countryside. The majority of the people in this area are farmers, raise animals or work daily in the city in different vocations. 

Norma is 40 years old. She is married and has three children who are 20, 18 and 3 years old. Her oldest daughter is studying in the university and also works to help her mother economically. Her second daughter is also studying in the university. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker. They own the house that hey live in. 

Norma is not in perfect health, she suffers from arthritis, which she is being treated for. The rest of the family is in good health. Norma works as an assistant for a cleaning service and also works as a janitor in a school, which she has been doing for the past 13 years. She also raises animals. 

The money from the last loan she took out she used to buy chickens and chicken feed. She is doing well in this economic endeavor and did not have any problems making her payments, always making them on time. This loan she will use to buy items to stock a store which is a new business she is going to start. She will run the small store out of her home. She likes the communal bank because of the commitment the group members show by making their payments and for the companionship within the group, each meeting they chat about many topics.

Her goal is to strengthen her businesses.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
Brima is 28 years old, single with one child age 10 years old. He runs an Internet cafe in Lumley western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Brima's child is currently attending school.

He has been in this business for six years and operates an internet cafe at Lumley road. His business is the only source of income he has. He works on his business 6 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is mechanical failure on the used computers.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more computers. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his child. In the future, he would like to expand his business more. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more computers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a baker. She bakes bread for sale in Mpohor near Takoradi which she has done for four years now. She is married to a businessman and has three children. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery. Elizabeth hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AÏDOTE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jocelyne Fidélia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jocelyne Fidélia est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Jocelyne Fidélia a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Jocelyne Fidélia est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jocelyne Fidélia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jocelyne Fidélia vend depuis quinze ans des produits ménagers (bols, bassines) et des tissus dans son quartier. Jocelyne Fidélia s’approvisionne au Bénin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jocelyne Fidélia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AÏDOTE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AÏDOTE group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Jocelyne Fidélia, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. Jocelyne Fidélia left school at the secondary level.  She is married to a man named Jean. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Jocelyne Fidélia lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple take care of the household's various needs. 

To meet her family's expenses, for the last fifteen years Jocelyne Fidélia has been selling kitchen wares (bowls, basins) and fabric in her neighborhood. She obtains her supplies in Benin, and sometimes in Lomé. In order to satisfy her customers and increase turnover and revenue, Jocelyne Fidélia and the other AÏDOTE members are asking ALIDé for a fourth loan. The three previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bowls, basins, etc.

loans.name: Junisa

texts.en:
Meet 30 year old Junisa from Lumley western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 2 years and 8 years old. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 2002, Junisa established his general merchandise business. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income to support his family. He also earns another source of income from a commercial bike. He works on the business 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of sufficient capital to invest in the business.

Junisa requires a loan in order to buy more milk, egg, butter, cheese, mayonnaise, sugar and perfume. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his level of income and the standard of living of his family. In the future, Junisa plans to open an outlet and employ staff. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more milk, eggs, butter, cheese, mayonnaise, sugar and perfume.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33 year old Mohamed from Lumley. He is married with five children between the ages of 5 years and 15 years. Four of his children attend school. 

Mohamed runs a Pharmacy at regent road Lumley. He sells cold tablets, malarial medicines, bathing soap, blood syrup and perfume. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works on the business six days per week, and has two employees working for him. He earns income from renting out a house. Mohamed says that the main challenge to his business is lack of collateral for the high amount of loans.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more cosmetic and medical drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his savings and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open more branches in a different location in the city. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy a cool tablets, malarial medicine, bathing soap, blood syrup and perfume.

loans.name: Mary Esi

texts.en: Mary Esi operates a drinking bar.  She sells soft drinks at Mpohor near Takoradi which she has done for five years now.  She is married with four children who are in school. Mary uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  She will use the loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to satisfy her customers. She plans to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah sells cosmetics at Mpohor near Takoradi.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a small scale miner.  Hannah has been selling cosmetics for three years.  She uses her income to assists her husband in the general up keep of their family.  Hannah will use her loan to purchase more cosmetices for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: purchase more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Dade

texts.en: Dade lives together with her husband, who is a driver, and three children in Mpohor near Takoradi. Dade is a baker. She bakes bread for sale. In the photo, she is removing the cooked bread from the oven. She uses the traditional oven. She has been baking for 15 years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery. Dade will use the profit from her expanded business to buy a modern oven for her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Missimahu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMAHU est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mélanie est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Mélanie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Mélanie est mariée à un agriculteur du nom de Sètondji. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mélanie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les diverses dépenses de la maison. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Mélanie vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des condiments et des produits de vivriers dans son quartier. Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mélanie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMAHU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MISSIMAHU group is made up of four people who all live in the same neighborhood. The is the third time that this group has asked ALIDé for financial help, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's leader, Mélanie, has her hand raised in the photo. Mélanie is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school for very long.

Mélanie is married to a farmer named Sètondji. The couple has five children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Mélanie lives with her husband and children. The couple share responsibility for the household's various expenses. In order to meet these expenses, for the last ten years or so Mélanie has been selling condiments and food products in her neighborhood. Mélanie obtains her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase turnover and revenue, Mélanie and the other MISSIMAHU members are asking ALIDé for a third loan. This loan is sure to allow them to expand their level of activity and make more profit. The two previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments and food products.

loans.name: Mercy Diana

texts.es:
La Señora Mercy es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeada por abundante vegetación, en donde se puede disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad del campo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Mercy tiene 22 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 2 hijas, una de 4 años y otra de 6 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Mercy labora hace 4 meses en una guardería, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Los fines de semana vende verduras ambulantemente en un mercado de la ciudad. En su casa cría pollos y cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en el noveno crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y verduras para continuar con el negocio. 

Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mercy is a member of the community bank 14 de Agosto. She lives in the Zhidmad parish in the city of Cuenca. The community is surrounded by abundant vegetation, where the peace and tranquility of the countryside can be enjoyed. The people of Zhidmad work in agriculture and the raising of livestock, and many work daily in the city in various activities. 

Mercy is 22 years old. She is married and with her husband has two daughters, a four year old and a six month old. Her husband works as a mason. Mercy does not have her own house but lives with her inlaws, with whom she shares living expenses.

Four months ago Mercy began working at a nursery, where she works Monday through Friday from 8 AM to 4 PM. On the weekends, she sells vegetables as a street vendor at a city market. She raises chickens and pigs at her house.

This is Mercy's ninth loan with the community bank. With it she will invest in the purchase of chickens, pigs, and vegetables in order to continue her business. Her goal is for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Nancy from Aberdeen western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 years and 18 years old.

Nancy runs an Africana dress store. She sells male and female dresses, ladies slippers and trousers. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works on the business six days per week. She also earns income from a commercial bike-in-town service. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.
 
Nancy has requested a loan in order to buy more male and female dresses, ladies slippers and trousers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she plans to export Africana in different countries. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more male and female dresses, ladies slippers and trousers.

loans.name: Winnifred

texts.en: Winnifred operates a grocery shop at Mpohr near Takoradi. This she has done for three years now.  The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscuit, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  She is married, and she uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.  With the new profit, Winnifred plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas owns a grocery shop in Mpohr near Takoradi. She has been operating this grocery shop for 10 years now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. She is married and has 12 dependents. Her husband is a small-scale miner. She uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the profit, Dorcas plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca operates a breakfast joint. She prepares oats and serves it with fried eggs and bread. She has been in this business for 5 years now. Rebecca lives together with her husband and 2 children at Mpohor near Takoradi. Her husband is a small scale miner. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. 

Rebecca will use her loan to purchase oats, eggs, and flour for her bread and other ingredients that she will need to prepare breakfast for sale. With the new profit, Rebecca will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase oats, eggs, and flour for her bread and other ingredients that she will need to prepare breakfast for sale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda operates a grocery shop at Mpohr near Takoradi. She has done this for 1 year now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscute, toffes, powdered milk, etc. She is married and has 3 children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. 

Linda will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
a Sra.  Pabla tiene 58 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad, de las cuales una de ella está casada.
Pabla se dedica a la fabricación de panificados en general como ser galletas, coquitos y diferentes panes, posee una vendedor y vende a su comunidad desde su propia casa. Ella nos comenta que se inicio en forma casera y luego ya fue equipando su microempresa que ya tiene 11 años de antigüedad. Su meta es seguir creciendo cada vez más y más para poder ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para compra de materia prima, como ser harina, sal, manteca y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que prepara. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Pabla is 58, married, and has two adult daughters, one of whom is married. Pabla makes baked goods such as cookies, coquitos (Paraguayan pastry treat) and various breads. She has a salesperson, and sells to her community from her own house. She tells us that she started working from home, and later started equipping her small business, that she has had for 11 years now.

Her goal is to keep growing more and more--to be a large business. She is applying for the loan in order to buy ingredients such as flour, salt, lard, and other supplies she needs to be able to continue making the food she prepares. She is grateful to the Foundation for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Soukeye

texts.fr: Madame Soukeye   vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 59 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de famille. Depuis plus de vingt ans elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et vent des articles  d’habillement. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce par passion. Et ce qui l’intéresse le plus  reste la recherche de profits.  Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis avril 2005. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’approvisionnement en tissus destinés à la vente. Elle compte augmenter son fond de roulement, et voyager  pour se procurer ses marchandises.son souhait est d’augmenter ses bénéfices pour renforcer le soutien  qu’il apporte aux membres de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Soukeye lives in Senegal.  She is 59 years old.  She is a widow and a mother.  For more than 20 years she has been involved in commerce and the sale of clothing.  She chose this type of business out of passion.  She is most interested in the profits to be made.  She is a member of I’U-IMCEC in the town where she has lived since April of 2005.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to build up the stock of fabric that she will sell.  She foresees raising her working capital and being able to travel in order to secure her merchandise.  Her wish is to increase her profits so that she can better support the other members of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell.

loans.name: Derlis Franco

texts.es:
El Sr. Derlis es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Encarnación. El se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, también trae productos desde la ciudad de posada y distribuye por el barrio por pedido. Su esposa es asalariada, trabaja en una empresa.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos dice que todo el sacrificio que hace es por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida mejor y sin privaciones como las que él tuvo que pasar.
Derlis solicita el crédito para la compra de pan, bebidas, carnes, arroz, fideos, azúcar y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y teniendo bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Derlis is married, has 3 children, and lives in his own home in the city of Encarnación. He makes a living doing business. He has a small pantry in his home and he also brings products from the city and distributes them throughout the neighborhood by order. His wife is wage-earning and works at a company. He defines himself as a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person, and tells us that all the sacrifices he makes are for his family since he wants to give them all they need for a better life without hardships like those he had to suffer.

Derlis is asking for a loan to buy bread, drinks, meat, rice, noodles, sugar, and other essential items with which he will be able to continue working and having his business be well stocked.

loans.use: to buy supplies with which to stock his pantry.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou est un homme de 52 ans qui s’active dans la vente d’aliments pour  bétails depuis plus de 40 ans. Il fait aussi de l’élevage de vaches. Pendant 40 ans, Mamadou n’a pratiquement pas eu besoin de recourir à une quelconque mutuelle pour y emprunter de l’argent. Mais vu présentement  qu’il a envie de plus développer son activité, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000F CFA  pour acheter une grande quantité d’aliments bétails.
Il a comme charges : de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de son foyer (car il est marié et père de 5 enfants) ; mais aussi de s’occuper de ses bêtes pour pouvoir les revendre. I l veut davantage augmenter son cheptel.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a 52 year old man who has been in the business of selling livestock feed for over 40 years.  He also raises cattle.  For 40 years, Mamadou has really had no need to turn to another party to borrow money.  But considering that he would now like to develop his business further, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 FCFA to buy a large supply of livestock feed. 
His responsibilities are to meet the daily needs of his household (as he is married and the father of five children), and to take care of his livestock in order to resell them.  He wants to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Mirian Mora

texts.es:
La Señora Mirian, de 36 años de edad está acompañada con el Señor Juan de 37 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ellos se encuentran viviendo el su humilde casa de la ciudad de Ita.
Ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa bien surdida, donde ofrece a sus vecinos y amigos, buen  precio y calidad en sus productos. La Señora Mirian anteriormente operaba en un grupo de comité de mujeres y de a poco fue creciendo hasta que ahora opera con un crédito de micro-comercio. Está muy contenta con la oportunidad que se le otorgo, pues gracias a la ayuda de la fundación ha podido crecer y llegar a donde está.
Mirian solicita el crédito para la compra de galletitas, bebidas, lácteos, comestibles y demás insumos para poder abastecer su negocio y seguir ofreciendo calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mirian is 36 years old, she is married to Juan who is 37 years old and with whom she has 3 children. They live together in their humble home, which is located in the city of Ita. 

She told us that she has a well stocked store, where she offers to her neighbors and friends, good prices and quality products. Before Mirian participated in a committee of women, that little by little grew to the point that now it operates with small business loans. She is very happy with the opportunity that she has been given, thanks to the help that she has been given through the foundation she has been able to expand her business and get to the place where she is today. 

Mirian requested this loan to buy cookies, drinks, milk products, groceries and other items to stock her store and continue offering quality service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Marième Ndiaye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Marième  Ndiaye vit dans une localité sénégalaise. Elle est âgée  de 30 ans et évolue dans le secteur de la petite restauration. Auparavant elle était femme de ménage dans  le guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est membre. Depuis 3 ans elle vend  le petit déjeuner, déjeuner et dîner  dans un coin du quartier ou elle habite. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion, et s’intéresse  plutôt aux bénéfices qui lui sont générés. Elle est sociétaire de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2007.  Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son fond de roulement et l’approvisionnement en huiles, œufs et autres denrées  de base qui entrent dans la préparation des repas qu’elle commercialise. Son  objectif est d’acheter a des prix plus complétifs, de  réduire ses dépenses et d’ accroitre ses bénéfices afin de mieux  prendre en charges ses propres besoins sociaux et  aussi contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie sociale de ses parents.
texts.en: Miss Marième Ndiaye lives in a town in Senegal.  She is 30 years old and is in the small restaurant business.  Before this she was a cleaning woman at the l’U-IMCEC office where she is a member.  For three years she has been serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner in the district where she lives.  She chose this business out of passion and is most interested in the profits it generates.  She has been a member of l’U-IMCEC since December of 2007.  She has already repaid two previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 frs to increase her working capital and to buy supplies of oils, eggs, and other staples necessary for preparing the meals that she sells.  Her goal is to be able to buy at more competitive prices, to reduce her expenses, and to grow her profits in order to meet her own social needs and also to contribute to improving the social life of her parents.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for preparing meals that she plans to sell.

loans.name: Elsa Pasmor

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa tiene 59 años, es soltera, y ella nos cuenta que tiene un hijo con capacidades diferentes, por el cual ella lucha incansablemente, y por quien da todo.
 Ella se dedica a la venta de productos en general, como ser shampoo, perfumes, enjuagues y demás, esto lo hace por toda la ciudad, y sus mayores clientes son docentes. Le gustaría para más adelante abrir una mercería en su casa,  ya que está cansada de vender de forma ambulante y quiere poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, ya que  dentro de poco se jubilara del centro en donde trabaja.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, perfumes, enjuagues y demás productos, con lo cual satisfará la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old, single, and tells us that she has a son with different abilities because of whom she labors tirelessly and for whom she gives everything.

She makes a living selling general products like shampoo, perfume, rinses, and others. She does this throughout the whole city and her greatest clients are teachers. Later on she would like to open a notions store in her home since she's tired of selling by means of travel. She wants to be able to give her clients more attention since within a short amount of time she will retire from the center where she works.

She is requesting the loan to buy cream, shampoo, perfume, rinses, and other products, with which she will satisfy her clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy cream, shampoo, perfume, rinses, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta Velazquez

texts.es:
