Yoel, tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, por su agricultura y por la generosidad que demuestran sus pobladores: Yoel es un joven muy trabajador anteriormente trabaja como albañil en obras de construcción , pero tuvo varios accidentes y que gracias a Dios nunca paso a mayores, por ello el decidió trabajar en otro rubro y gracias a su esfuerzo y a su lucha constante, el ahorro dinero y pudo comprar dos mototaxis; él trabajaba en una y la otra la alquila y con ello tiene un poco mas de ingresos, desde hace dos años el viene esforzándose mucho, el cree que gracias a ese esfuerzo y sobre todo la ayuda de Dios y el apoyo incondicional de su esposa es que le va bien en su negocio.

Yoel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar el mantenimiento a sus mototaxis, así como también cambiarles los asiento, así el podrá mejorar su vehículo y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando día a día para cumplir su gran sueño:”Darle una profesión a su hijo e iniciar un negocio en su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Yoel is 23 years old and lives with his wife and young son in the city of Imperial, a city that is characterized by its warm climate, agriculture and the generosity of its inhabitants. Yoel is a young very hard worker that used to work as a mason in construction sites but had many accidents and thankfully it was never serious and decided to work in another field. Thanks to Yoel’s hard work and constant struggle he saved enough money and was able to buy two motorcycle taxis. He works with one motorcycle taxi and the other he rents and is able to have a bit more income. Yoel has worked hard for about two years and believes that his efforts but above all God’s help and the unconditional support of his wife have helped his business do well.

Yoel is very grateful to the Kiva loaners since thanks to their help he will be able to make some maintenance repairs on his motorcycle taxis as well as change the seats to improve the vehicles and provide better service to his customers. This will allow him to have better income and give his family a better quality of life as well as to continue working each day to see his greatest dream come true, “see his son become a professional and to start a business in his home.”

loans.use: make maintenance repairs and change the seats.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon, 63, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately USD 20 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who approximately earns USD 10 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mon is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rice to resell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Sony

texts.en: Sony, 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over five years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is involved in breeding pigs to sell. He earns approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sony is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business renting music equipment and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Zavhan province in Western Mongolia. Her husband  is an entrepreneur who runs the taxi service. Her two children study in college and high school. She has been running a meat retailing business since 2000. The business has been stable and successful in these years as there are many regular suppliers and customers in the town. Dolgorsuren is a good- natured and intelligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies, some sheep so that I could trade them in wholesale and raise the income". The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the sheep and to buy spare parts for her husband's car.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and to buy spare part for the car

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening cattle. She earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns about USD 4 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Nam is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Luciben

texts.en:
This is Luciben, 29, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Evelyn, his business partner. Luciben, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luciben operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small house wares store, where he sells retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers or basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Luciben hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Shelan

texts.en:
Shelan is a 23-year-old young Iraqi wife. She has been using her sewing skills for the past three years, seeking opportunities to contribute to her family's financial needs.

In the past Shelan has successfully received and repaid a loan to Relief International Microfinance Iraq. With the loan, she was able to buy an old, but good, sewing machine with a table and chair. 

Now Shelan is taking a loan for $1800 USD to improve her work area and to be able to buy more fabric and raw materials for her business. 

Because Shelan is under 30, she qualifies for a 'youth loan.'

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area and be able to buy more fabric and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Subihiya

texts.en:
Subihiya is a 50-year-old mother of six from northern Israel. She has run a book and gift shop for several years and now is diversifying her store to strengthen its sales capability. While books are still a popular item, Subihiya has seen a drop in sales and profit and has decided to begin including additional items in her store. There is a degree of seasonality to her merchandise and after careful consideration of what customers need and want from the store, she is expanding. Her first addition is to include sportswear, gifts and school items.


Subihiya needed this loan to expand and diversify her merchandise to purchase sports shoes, toys, clothing and perfumes.

In the future Subihiya wants to continue to stabilize her sales and add school uniforms and supplies. She is proud of her accomplishments but knows if she wants her business to remain profitable, she must adapt.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her merchandise to purchase sports shoes, toys, clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está divorciado,  vive con su papa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y mano de obra para asistir la siembra de café. el cuenta con una plantación de ya en producción por lo cual necesita asistirla pues esta cosecha pasado dio un buen rendimiento y necesita fortalecerse para la próxima cosecha. El tiene pensado con esta asistencia darle el máximo de mejoras para obtener de él un buen rendimiento en producción el próximo año y generar mayores ganancias a esta cosecha pasada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is 50, divorced and lives with his father.  With this loan he plans to buy inputs to improve his coffee crop, such as fertilizer, and to pay for laborers to tend the coffee trees.  He has a plantation which is nearing harvest time.  His last harvest was very good and needs to assure success in the next crop.  With this assistance he hopes to maximize production next near and generate higher profits.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has no banking credit history, but FUDECOSUR has offered good terms and very low interest rates.

loans.use: to tend his coffee plantation

loans.name: Rodolfo Fallas Vargas

texts.es: Rodolfo, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de alimento y vitaminas de buena calidad y adecuados, además de tener cerdos de razas de buen desarrollo y con carne de buena calidad. Al poder comprar todos los materiales a utilizar espera tener una producción con un buen desarrollo y posteriormente un ingreso adecuado para así darle el sustento a su familia y pagar lo que le corresponde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rodolfo is 35, single, and lives with his parents and siblings.  With this credit he plans to buy animal feed and good quality vitamins to raise well-developed pigs to produce high quality pork.  By buying these items he hopes to increase production, resulting in enough income to support his family. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken out prior loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him good terms and very low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Julio Cesar Apolinario Crespin

texts.es: Julio de 20 años  vive( guasmo Guayaquil) – el escogió este trabajo porque sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo que es la pesca de cangrejos. El trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas y esfuezo. En el futuro el desea engrandar su negocio teniendo mas salidas para pescar. Con el préstamo comprara (redes para la pesca etc).
texts.en: Julio is 20 and lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil, Ecuador.  He chose the same line of work of his parents: crab fishing.  He works hard every day and hopes to grow his business by increasing his fishing capacity.  With this loan, he will buy fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mayra Mirella Garces Villalta

texts.es: Mayra de 29 años vive( duran ecuador). Ella empeso vendiendo de apoco ropa. Luego fue progresando. También es profesora particular le enseña a  los niños de su barrio. Trabaja todos los días sola con esfuerzo. A futuro ella desea ampliar su local de ropa. Con el préstamo comprara ( libros y ropa para mejorar sus ingresos etc).
texts.en: Mayra is 29 and lives in Duran, Ecuador.  She has recently begun to sell clothing, which so far has been going well.  She also works as a private teacher for children in her neighborhood.  She works hard every day and in the future would like to grow her clothing sales.  With this loan, she will buy books and clothing items, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy school books and clothing

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio Tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

José es maestro da clases en una escuela de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un computador.
 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá contar con una computadora para poder realizar los planes didácticos, realizar las pruebas de los alumnos y le servirá para poder realizar otros trabajos. 

La compra lo realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño  es ser un profesional y utilizar de la mejor manera la tecnología para lo posterior pensar en un negocio.

Los desaf{ios a los que se enfrenta son la falta de dinero cuando más se necesita. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear e irse de vacaciones y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en: José Antonio is 26, single, with no children.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo, Bolívar province, Ecuador.  José is a teacher in a local school  He seeks this credit in order to buy a computer.  With this credit, he plans to use the computer to complete his lesson plans and student tests, as well as many other tasks.  He plans to purchase the computer in the city of Guaranda.  His dream is to work as a professional and make best use of technology to eventually open a business.  He faces the challenge of not having enough capital when he needs it.  In his free time he enjoys taking trips and working in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Alba Rebeca

texts.es:
Alba Rebeca tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 15 años de edad en Chimbo Provincia de bolívar.

Alba se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, fungicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá estar tranquilo porque va ha tener dinero para trabajar en los cultivos.

El sueño es poder tener terrenos propios para aumentar el ingreso para la familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en: Alba Rebeca is 49, married, has one child and lives with her husband and 15-year old son in Chimbo, Bolívar province, Ecuador.  Alba is a corn farmer.  She seeks this credit in order to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, fungicides.  This loan will give her peace of mind and resources to tend her crops.  She dreams of working her own land to increase her family's income.  Her main challenge is competition.  In her free time she enjoys caring for animals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, fungicides.

loans.name: Antonia Beatriz Armijo Vergara

texts.es:
Antonia Beatriz tiene 63 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Antonia se dedica a cuidar niños, es niñera. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar bienes cómo muebles, cocina, cortinas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel de Bolívar.

El sueño es poder tener todo lo necesario en la casa. Enfrenta desafíos cómo la responsabilidad en el trabajo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cocer y caminar por el campo.
texts.en: Antonia Beatriz is 63, married and has 3 children;  she lives with her husband and children in Chimbo, Bolívar province, Ecuador.  Antonia cares for children in a nursery. She seeks this credit in order to buy furniture, a stove and curtains. This loan will improve her quality of life.  She plans to make her purchases in San Miguel de Bolívar.  She dreams of having everything she needs at home.  Her greatest challenge is meeting her work responsibilities.  In her free time she enjoys cooking and walking in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy furniture, a stove and curtains

loans.name: Cesar Isidro Sisa Quincha

texts.es:
Cesar Isidro tiene 45 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de 6 años, vive con los padres en Chimbo provincia de bolívar.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cebada.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes, líquidos para la maleza, fungicidas. Con la yuad del crédito podrá podrá incrementar la siembra.

Las compras lo hace Chimbo cada mes. El sueño es poder comprar terrenos incrementar los ingresos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Cesar Isidro, 45, is single and has a six-year-old son.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo in the province of Bolívar, and works in agriculture growing corn and barley.

He is requesting a loan to buy compost, urea, fertilizers, weed killers and fungicides.  With the help of the loan he will be able to increase his planting activity.

He buys his supplies monthly in Chimbo.  His goal is to buy land and increase his income.

His main challenge is the competition.  In his free time he enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: To buy compost, urea, fertilizers, weed killers and fungicides.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
La clienta Yamileth tiene varios años de trabajar en forma independiente ,ofreciendo en su comunidad servicios de podología,  cuido de los pies de personas diabéticas y adultos mayores.

Ella todos los días programa su trabajo por citas , a domicilio y también atiende sus labores domésticas.

Es una mujer joven que fue madre soltera , jefa de hogar ,y  en su lucha por darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija, decide aprovechar su experiencia y conocimiento , e inicia su propia microempresa.
En este momento su hija , quien es estudiante ,   requiere de un tratamiento odontológico, el cual ella no puede cubrir con sus ahorros, y busca apoyo económico en la fundación para solventarlo en su totalidad.
Ya ella ha recibido créditos para desarrollar su microempresa , en los cuales se ha destacado por una excelente moral de pago.
texts.en:
The borrower, Yamileth, has been working independently for several years, providing podology services in her community and taking care of the feet of diabetics and elderly patients.

She shedules her daily appointments to treat the patients in their home.  She also takes care of her own home and handles the household chores.

She is a young woman who is a single mother and head of household.  In an effort to give her daughter the best living conditions possible she took advantage of her expertise and knowledge and began her own small business.

Her daughter, who is a student, is in need of orthodontic treatment and Yamileth is unable to cover the cost with her savings, so she is looking for financial support through the institution.

She has received other loans to develop her business and always has enjoyed an excellent credit recoerd.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's orthodontist services.

loans.name: Esmeralda Crystel Ramos Wong

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja, el cual trabaja como ingeniero y junto a su hijo de 2 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo tiene un clima cálido, hermosas playas y sus pobladores se caracteriza por tener una buena sazón para la preparación de cualquier platillo. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida y uno de sus platos favoritos son los tallarines; en su tiempo libre disfruta de salir a pasear con su familia para tener un tiempo de familia.

Con mucho esfuerzo Esmeralda trabaja en su negocio de venta de hamburguesas, así como también vende productos de belleza; ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón en la preparación de platillos y atiende a los clientes de manera amable.

Esmeralda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar dos computadoras para poder ofrecer en su negocio el servicio de escaneos y tipeos por las mañanas; lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y mejorar la cálida de vida de su familia, así como también seguir luchando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:”Darle una buena educación a su hijo y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a very young, enthusiastic worker who is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband who is an engineer.  They have a 2-year-old son and live in the city of Chincha, which is known as the birthplace of one of the Peruvian sports stars.  It also has a warm climate and beautiful beaches, and the locals are known for their delicious culinary arts.  Being typically Peruvian she loves to eat; and one of her favorite dishes is noodles.  In her free time she enjoys taking walks and spending time with family.

With much effort, Esmeralda works selling hamburgers, and also sells beauty products.  She works about five hours a day, attending to some 70 customers daily.  She thinks business is going well because the food she makes is tasty and because she treats people with kindness.

Esmeralda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy two computers so she can set up a bar code system and scanning service in her business.  This will increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of living.  It will also help her meet her greatest goal which is: "Giving her son a good education and a university degree".

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Darwin Rolando Ula Tamami

texts.es:
Darwin Rolando tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

Darwin es profesor da clases en una escuela. Solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos ,un refrigerador, microondas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los bienes con mayor felicidad. El sueño es poder seguir estudiando para sacar una maestría.

 El desafío al que se enfrenta es poder llegar a quedarse en el trabajo ser estable y no con contratos. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte, jugar indor, y bailar.
texts.en:
Darwin Rolando, 23, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo in the province of Bolívar.

Darwin is a school teacher and he is requesting a loan to buy domestic appliances, a refrigerator and microwave.

The loan will make it easier for him to acquire the appliances.  His goal is to continue his education to get a master's degree.

The challenge he is facing is being able to have a stable job instead of working on a contract basis.  In his free time he enjoys sports, playing indoor soccer, and dancing.

loans.use: To buy domestic appliances, a refrigerator and microwave.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera con un hijo como carga directa. Vive en casa de su madre, la cual firma como aval del crédito. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
La actividad a la que se dedica Ana María es a la venta de cerveza, negocio que viene administrando desde hace 2 años, tomando las riendas de este cuando su madre dejó el negocio, es decir, conoce a la perfección el rubro.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles, que serán empleados en la compra de cerveza. Este negocio cuenta con competencia, pero con un amplio mercado de comercialización.
texts.en:
Ana María, 28, is single and has a child in her direct care.  She lives with her mother, who is the co-signer for the loan, in a rural district of Lambayeque which has all the basic utilities.

Ana María has been in the business of selling beer for two years.  She took over management when her mother ceased in the business, so she is well acquainted with the sector.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 PEN which she will use to buy beer.  There is competition in the industry but also a broad market in which to do business.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina, 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are teachers. Approximately, they earn USD 8 per day. 

Because the present house is too cramped, Salina is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger, and to provide convenient living condition for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her present house.

loans.name: Andres Rojas Delgado

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre de 56 años de edad, tiene un hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia en el centro poblado Matriz Comunidad, en el distrito de Pacora y cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 300  familias.
La actividad que realiza Andrés es la crianza y venta de animales, por la zona de Pacora, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, vende especialmente  animales como carneros y vacunos, cliente también se dedica a la agricultura y también percibe ingresos como jornalero y venta de leche.
El destino del crédito por 3500 nuevos soles es la compra de animales, especialmente de ganado vacuno y caprino.
texts.en:
Andrés is 56 years old and has one dependent son.  He lives in his own home in the village of Matriz Comunidad, in Pacora district.  He has both electricity and water.  This is a small community of approximately 300 families.

Andrés' business activity is raising and selling animals in Pacora region.  He has experience in the business and he mainly sells rams and cattle.  He also farms and, in addition, makes income working as an agricultural laborer and selling milk.  He is requesting 3,500 soles to buy animals, especially cattle and goats.

loans.use: to acquire animals for his business

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Juancio, a vendor, and a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merlita operates a handicrafts business. What she basically does is buy raw materials used in handy-crafts making from a supplier, then she manufactures these items to make different products in order to sell them on a per piece for a profit. Products can range from lanterns, lampshades and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 5000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 32, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlita dreams to expand her business and help her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmelita Balingit

texts.en:
Carmelita is married with 3 children. Carmelita is 57-years-old and lives in Patawag, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Carmelita owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month she earns PHP 30000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase more inventory for her general store.

Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Carmelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Narcisa Beatriz

texts.es:
Narcisa Beatriz tiene 31 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo, vive con los padres y con el hijo de 6 años de edad en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

Narcisa se dedica a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales como pollos, ganado, patos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para luego poder venderlos a un buen precio. 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los males que le da a los pollos, y la falta de dinero. El sueño es poder comprar una casita pequeña para vivir con la familia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar con el hijo.
texts.en:
Narcisa Beatriz is 31 years old.  She is a single mother and has one child.  She lives with her parents and 6-year-old son in Chimbo, in Bolívar province.

Narcisa's business is raising livestock.  She is requesting a loan to buy animals such as chickens, cattle and ducks.  With the help of this loan she will be able to buy animals which she will later sell at a good price.

The challenges that she faces are sicknesses suffered by her chickens and a lack of money.  Her dream is to buy a small house where she can live with her family.

In her free time, Narcisa enjoys playing with her son.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens, cattle and ducks

loans.name: Victor Hugo Guanipatin Caluna

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cebada. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos para los cultivos y mejorar los sembríos.   Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel cada 6 meses.

El sueño es poder mejorar el estilo de vida. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo is 22 years old.  He is single, doesn't have any children, and lives with his parents in Chimbo, in Bolívar province.

Víctor is a farmer who grows corn and barley.  He is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers, urea and liquid treatments for controlling weeds.

With the help of this loan, Víctor will be able to buy the supplies he needs for growing and improving his crops.  He makes his purchases and sales in San Miguel every six months.

Víctor's dream is to improve his lifestyle.  The challenge that he faces is the competition.

In his free time, Víctor enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, urea and liquid treatments for controlling weeds

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is a 29-years-old widowed woman who lives with her 3 children in Hovd Province, in Western Mongolia. Her oldest child studies at the secondary school and the other children are 3 and 1 years old. She has been running a fruits and vegetable retailing business since 2008. She used to run the business with her husband before and now she is responsible for the business and the family. 

She buys the products from the border city in wholesale. She has a further plan to continue the business activity as it is the only financial source for the family members. Oyun-Erdene is a good-natured woman who says that, "I would like to expand the business activity by bringing the supplies in large amount. Because the season is coming and there would be more customers to purchase the fruits and vegetable". 

The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase the fruits and vegetables from China.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables from China.

loans.name: Otgondemberel

texts.en:
Otgondemberel is a 44-years-old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in Zavhan Province in Western Mongolia. His wife and the oldest child are unemployed and the other 3 children study at the college. He has been making ovens, cookers, chimneys, entrances and other iron equipment. He trades the products in the neighboring towns. He is a talented man who makes the perfect products. The regular customers in the neighboring towns appreciate the service he supplies. 

Now he is working on a project and plans to continue the business by purchasing the supplies in large amount. Otgondemberel is a skilled man who says that "I would like to continue the business and expand it by getting the necessary materials in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting is 2,670,000 MNT to purchase the necessary iron materials.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary iron materials.

loans.name: Beato Juan

texts.es:
Beato tiene 27 años, vive junto a su pareja y sus dos pequeños hijos d dos y cinco años de edad en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo es una ciudad que tiene un clima cálido en cualquier época del año y también por la agricultura en especial por el cultivo de uva, esparrago, alcachofa y paprika. Como buen peruano a Beato le gusta mucho la comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Pollo Asado”. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando gastronomía y va en el primer año de la carrera.

Beato tiene su negocio de alquiler de video juegos, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 14 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece una buena atención y su local es amplio.

Beato está agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar un televisor y tres consolas de videojuegos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y atender más clientes, así seguirá trabajando para poder lograr su más grande sueño.” Tener su casa propia y un restaurante”.
texts.en: Beato is 27 years old. He lives with his partner and his two young children who are 2 and 5 years old. They live in the city of Ica, a city which is home to one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, the Huacachina Lake. Ica is a city that enjoys hot weather year round and is noted for its farming, in particular for its cultivation of grapes, asparagus, artichokes and paprika. As a good Peruvian, Beato really enjoys our cuisine and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious 'pollo asado' (marinated, grilled chicken). He is currently studying for a degree in cookery and is in his first year. Beato has a business renting out video games. He works around 12 hours a day in his business and can serve up to 14 customers. He believes that his business is doing well because he offers good customer service and his premises are large. Beato is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a television set and three video-game consoles. This will allow him to improve his income and serve more customers. This will mean he can continue working in order to fulfill his biggest dream: to own his own home and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a PlayStation and a television set

loans.name: Suma Kantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA KANTATI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Isabel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de medias y ropa interior, tejido busos y mantas, venta de huevos, artesana en joyas, venta de caldo de cardan, comerciante, venta de picota y chuntillo.

La señora Isabel, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace un año y medio, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de orfebrería (elaboración de joyas de oro), que viene trabajando hace años, conjuntamente su esposo. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de material para joyería) mismos que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "Suma Kantati" community bank are about to start their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Isabel.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling socks and underwear, knitting sweaters and blankets, selling eggs, hand-making jewelry, selling 'caldo de cardan' (a soup made from bull's genitals which is considered an aphrodisiac) and selling 'picotas' and 'chuntillos' (rustic tools).

Isabel says that she has been a community bank member for one and a half years, having joined through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a business making gold jewelry that she has been working in with her husband for years. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to expand her stock (buying materials for making jewelry).  She will acquire these in El Alto and, after she has made her items, she will sell them to order.  This work allows her to support her family.  She is married and has seven children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Isabel replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Darwin Rojas

texts.en: Darwin, a married father of four children, is 37 years old and lives in Comunal, Lioy, Zamboanga del Norte. For 10 years Darwin has owned and operated a general store to make a living, earning 15000 PHP each month. A member of PMPC for one year, he is requesting a loan of 30000 PHP to purchase more stocks for the store. In the future, Darwin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline, a 54-year-old widowed mother of three children, lives in Pob.2, Oroquieta City where she has a restaurant offering a variety of cooked foods. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month, and is now requesting a loan of PHp 10,000 to purchase meats, spices and fish. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase meats, spices and fish.

loans.name: Roxana Viviana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión Libre, vive con los suegros y con los hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Roxana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, maíz, naranja además se dedica a la venta de productos Avon.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá sembrar y comprar los insumos para los cultivos,
El sueño  es poder tener una casa y comprar un terreno para trabajar para la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los problemas con la pareja por motivos de dinero.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los hijos y los estudios.
texts.en:
Roxana is 22 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her in-laws and her children (ages 4 and 2) in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Roxana is a member of the February 25th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Guabito in Zapotal parish and is part of the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in agricultural work.

Roxana is a farmer who grows cacao, corn, and oranges. She also sells Avon products. Roxana is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and liquid weed killer. She buys and sells in Ventanas. With the help of this loan, she will be able to grow her crops and buy the supplies that she needs.

Her dream is to have a house and to buy a plot of land on which her family can work. The challenges she faces include the financial problems she and her partner have. In her free time, Roxana enjoys being with her children and studying.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Josephine has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 22 years. 

She requested a loan for 29,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Janet has a store  that sells a variety of products such as soap, soft drinks and other basic needs. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Janet has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, membre du groupe de crédit «Iragi », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 4 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuses des articles divers. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  a été mariée. Son mari est un soudeur  spécialisé dans la métallurgie. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  14eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de maïs, sorgho, farine, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir, ouvrir une boutique.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: The customer, Kavira, who is a member of the Iragi loan group, is a 42-year old entrepreneur. She is married and mother to four young children who are all at school. She sells a variety of products and began her business when she got married. Her husband is a welder who specialises in metalwork. She has just been granted her 14th loan from Hekima and she will use this loan to stock up with two sacks of corn, sorghum, flour, etc..Moreover she would like to see her children grow up and open a shop. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions towards making poor women, who do not have access to classic banks, autonomous. It should be noted that some of the customers are carrying their babies in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for two sacks of corn, sorghum, flour, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Lani has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

Lani has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Lani hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Serlys

texts.en:
Serlys  is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion II, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
 
Serlys has a general store that sells variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Serlys has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Serlys hopes to own a house and a lot.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is married and has five children. Leonita is 38 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonita owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Leonita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Leonita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Christylyn

texts.en:
This is Christylyn, 34, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Benigno, a driver, and is mother to their eight children. She has managed to support her children's schooling and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Christylyn oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Christylyn dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets  with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, a 42-year-old married mother of five, lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental where she has operated a dried fish retail business for 15 years. A member of PMPC for four years, Juvy is requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase a variety of dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dried fish.

loans.name: Kavira

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est  entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, mariée. Elle est  vendeuses des articles divers. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  a été mariée. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans les affairese  pour la prospérité de leur foyer. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  15eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  les habits, huile, Fanta,farine, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer, Kavira, is a 42-year old entrepreneur who is married. She sells a variety of products and began her business when she got married. She helps out her husband with the business for the prosperity of their household. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her 15th loan from Hekima and this new loan will be used to get fresh supplies of clothing, oil, Fanta, flour etc. Furthermore, she would like to see her children grow up and buy them a piece of land. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to help poor women, who cannot access classic banks, to become autonomous.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, oil, Fanta, flour, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ifra Yéro

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Ifra Yéro .Il est âgé de 38 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 7 ans de son 1er mariage et le cadet 6 ans. C’est sa 1ère expérience de crédit et il demande un montant de 500000F CFA pour acheter de l’aliment de bétail pour son élevage. 
Il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer  et les charges liées à son élevage de bœufs. Avec  les revenus de son activité il va pouvoir améliorer  les conditions alimentaires  de sa famille, rembourser son crédit et même épargner.
Comme projet futur, il aimerait avoir un puits pour le breuvage des animaux.
texts.en: Our borrower's name is Ifra Yéro and he is 38 years old and father to four children, the eldest of whom is seven years old and from his first marriage, and the youngest six years old. This is his first loan experience and he is requesting 500,000FCFA so that he can buy food for the livestock he is raising. He manages his household expenses and the costs related to his raising of oxen. With the income from his business he will be able to improve his family's nutrition, repay his loan and even save some money. As a future project he would like to have a well for the animals to drink from.

loans.use: to buy food for livestock that he is raising

loans.name: Cristina Maribel

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 20 años, se describe como una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. Cristina vive con sus padres y su hijo de tres años en Latacunga Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Critina trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos, este trabajo es muy importante para ella debido a que es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su hijo y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, es por eso que realiza un crédito en Fodemi con la aspiración de progresar, este crédito va a invertir en la compra de crías de cerdos para crianza y engorde posteriormente para la venta. Con esta inversión Cristina mejorará la calidad de vida de su hijo y de sus padre ya que podrá tener un ingreso bueno.

Cristina sueña con superarse cada día mas y poder entrar a estudiar la universidad.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 20-year-old woman who describes herself as a very responsible and hardworking person. She lives with her parents and her three-year-old son in Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province.

Cristina works alone raising pigs. This work is very important to her because it is the only source of income by which she is able to support her son and help her parents with the household expenses. For this reason, she has received a loan from FODEMI in hopes of making progress. The loan will be invested in the expenses related to raising and fattening pigs so that they can eventually be sold. With this investment, Cristina will improve the quality of life for her son and her parents since she will have a better income.

Cristina dreams of achieving more success each day and being able to gain admission into a university.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses related to raising and fattening pigs.

loans.name: Rik

texts.en:
Rik, 39, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice and breeding pigs to sell for over 20 years. Additionally, her husband is a driver. They earn about USD 10 per day. 

Rik is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials (timbers) to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her present house.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan, 36, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Jonathan operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Jonathan's for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories. His regular customers are the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jonathan hopes his business grows more in the coming years. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Khardiatou Oumar

texts.fr:
Elle est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et elle a 3 enfants qui ont entre 15 et 9 ans. Elle s’appelle madame Khardiatou Oumar  et elle s’active dans la vente de légumes depuis 8 ans déjà	. Elle renouvelle un crédit de 100000F CFA pour  acheter  beaucoup de légumes car sa clientèle à augmenté entre temps.
Elle n’a pas de charges concernant la famille sinon ses propres charges personnelles. Le crédit impacte sur sa façon de faire car elle réussi à épargner désormais  et rembourse correctement son crédit. Elle pense même à faire de l’embouche en achetant petit à petit de jeunes vaches qui pourront sereproduire.
texts.en: This lady is 50 years old and married with three children between 9 and 15 years old. Her name is Khardiatou Oumar and she has been selling vegetables for eight years now. She is renewing a loan of 100,000FCFA to buy a large quantity of vegetables as her customer base has grown in the mean time. She does not have any family expenses to cover apart from her own personal expenses. The loan will have an impact on her way of doing thingssince she manages to save money now and repay her loan. She is even thinking of taking up animal fattening, by gradually buying young cows who can reproduce.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rogger Armando Misaico Perez

texts.es:
Rogger un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo es una ciudad que tiene un clima cálido en cualquier época del año y también por la agricultura en especial por el cultivo de uva, esparrago, alcachofa y paprika. Como buen peruano a Rogger le gusta mucho la comida y uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ají Gallina” y en sus tiempos libres que son mayormente en la noche le gusta ver televisión para distraerse.

Con mucho esfuerzo él trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, se dedica alrededor de 13 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque maneja con cuidado y los clientes se sienten más seguros cuando usan sus servicios.

Rogger está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar la moto que maneja actualmente a sus padres ya que ellos se la alquilan para que puedan trabajar; lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”
texts.en:
Rogger is a 25 year old young man who lives in the city of Inca.  The city is known for having one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, La Laguna de Huacachina.  It is a city with a year-round warm climate.  It is also known for its farming, especially for growing grapes, asparagus, artichokes, and paprika.  

As a good Peruvian, Rogger really likes the food.  One of his favorite dishes is the delicious “Ají Gallina” (chili chicken).  In his free time, which is mostly at night, he likes to watch television to entertain himself.

He works as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver with a great deal of effort.  He works around 13 hours a day, and he is able to take care of up to 60 customers.  He believes that his business is going well for him because he drives carefully.  The customers feel safer when they use his services.

Rogger is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to buy the moto that he currently drives.  His parents rent it in order to be able to work.  Purchasing the moto will allow him to have greater income, and it will allow him to keep working to be able to fulfill his biggest dream:  To have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has one child. 

Estrella has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of 17,000 to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snacks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is married with four children. She is 56 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Concordia sells puto (steamed rice cake) and other snacks like ice candy (popsicles) to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

Concordia has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marina es separada tiene 50 años  de edad y tiene 2 hijos, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan” grupo  conformado por  6  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Marina  se dedica a la venta de comida es decir vende ceviche desde hace dos años este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio ya que Marina tenía que mantener su hogar y es así que empezó vendiendo ceviche los fines de semana , hoy en día ya cuenta con clientes fidelizados, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida, se ha comprado artefactos eléctricos  , Marina  solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora para seguir creciendo en su negocio . Marina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Marina is 50 years old, separated, and has two children.  She is currently a member of the “Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" (Hope and Progress of Huaycan) communal bank.  The group is comprised of six members who devote themselves to different commercial activities.

Marina sells food, that is to say that she has been selling “ceviche” (a fish dish) for two years.  The business emerged as a result of her divorce.  Marina needed to support her household.  That is how she started selling ceviche on the week-ends.

Now she has loyal customers.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to improve her income, her children have a better quality of life, and she has bought some electrical appliances.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator in order to continue growing in her business.  Marina will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort.  The loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
This is Jamela, 25, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Jamela operates a retail business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells them for little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothing and similar products. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW (ready to wear) products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jamela hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Edwina

texts.en:
This is Edwina, 56, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with three children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Edwina operates a video/karaoke shop. She provides a place in her house to be used by customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine. She also operates two tricycle units (motorcycles with a passenger cab) for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8000 loan. She will use the loan to pay for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine and tricycle units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edwina hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for her karaoke machine and tricycles

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has four children. She is 61 years old and lives in North Mapang, Rizal.

To earn a living, Mila has a beauty salon business. She has had this business for twenty years. She earns approximately PHP 4,600 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase equipment for her beauty salon business.  

Mila has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Rosita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. Her husband often performs delivery jobs. Her daughters are 16 and 12 years old, and they study at the local secondary school. 

Purevsuren has been running a cellular phone repair business since 2008. She brings supplies from the capital city and uses them to fix her customers' broken phones. She runs the business from a shop counter in the biggest market in the center of the province. She is planning further to develop her business activities. Purevsuren is a bright woman who says, "I would like to expand the business by getting the equipment to fix smart phones after taking a short-term course on the subject." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment for the repair of cell phones.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the repair of cell phones

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and two kids in Central Mongolia. His wife is employed. His kids are in secondary school and kindergarten. 

Baasansuren has been making wooden products and selling them at the market. He has attracted many regular customers because of his good design and quality materials. He regularly makes furniture and other items. Building on his experience, he plans further to develop his business by purchasing supplies in large quantities to build school tables with attached chairs. 

Baasansuren is a talented man who says, "I would like to expand the business to raise the family income and improve the household." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials to make school tables and chairs.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make school tables and chairs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael, 30, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and manages his household while operating the business. He is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Michael operates a barbeque stall. He regularly buys fish and meat to cook and sell in the afternoons at his barbeque stand near his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy larger quantities fish and meat. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business.

Michael hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients for his barbecue business.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Ligaya is providing multi-purpose van services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

Ligaya has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Rafael Roberto

texts.es:
Rafael Roberto tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Rafael se dedica a la elaboración de juegos pirotécnicos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pólvora, carrizos, papel y también  va a aprovechar para poder hacer la tesis de grado.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el trabajo de grado y elaborar la volatería.

Las compras de los materiales lo hará en Chimbo. El sueño es poder obtener el título universitario para poder trabajar y ayudar a los padres.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte jugar indor, boly.
texts.en:
Rafael Roberto, age 26, is single and does not have children.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo in the Bolívar province.

Rafael makes fireworks.  He is requesting the loan to buy gunpowder, reeds, and paper.  He will also make use of the loan to be able to do his thesis work.  With the help of the loan he will be able to do his final project for graduation and make the fireworks.

He will buy the materials in Chimbo.  His dream is to be able to get his university degree in order to be able to work and help his parents.  The challenge that he faces is the lack of money.

In his free time he likes to play indoor volleyball.

loans.use: to buy gunpowder, reeds, paper, and to be able to do his thesis work.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is a 53-year-old man who lives with his wife in Darhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. He and his wife are retirees. Their children live separately in the town. 

Enhbaatar has started a taxi service with his minibus, driving his clients to other cities. The local people appreciate the service he supplies. The destinations are centrally located in Mongolia so he always has many customers. He is expanding the business and sends some money to his three children living in the town. Enhbaatar is a nice man who says, "I would like to expand my business further by fixing the car's motor so that I can improve the living standard of my household." The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase a motor for his minibus.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his minibus

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. 

Sabina has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, household products, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Sabina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with eight children. 

Corazon has a shop where she sells clothing such as t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Luzminda Group

texts.en:
Luzminda, a 54-year-old married mother of five, lives in P-4, Pan-ay, Clarin where she has been a farmer growing fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living for 30 years. A member of PMPC for seven years and the leader of a three-person group, Luzminda is requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase additional fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Fenou Group

texts.fr: FENOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Cathérine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 36 ans. Cathérine est mariée à un certain Samuel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cathérine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Cathérine a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Cathérine mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile depuis sept ans. Cathérine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et de se faire plus de profit, Cathérine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe FENOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
FENOU is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Cathérine (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 36 years old. Cathérine is married to a man named Samuel. The couple has two children, both of whom attend school and are in the care of their parents. Cathérine lives with her children and her husband, and she and her husband cover the household expenses together. Cathérine stopped her studies during primary school.

To cover her expenses, Catherine has been selling charcoal from her home for seven years now. Cathérine stocks up at a market in Benin.

Striving to better meet the demand of her ever-growing customer base and increase her profits, Cathérine is seeking, along with the other members of the FENOU group, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Yana Ñawi, tiene 37 años, es madre de 5 hijos, esta en Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de papa seca por mayor, esta muy agradecida a Finca por las cosas que pudo aprender, en ningún lugar le supieron aconsejar como en las capacitaciones que ha recibido de su Banco Comunal, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de papa para poder procesarla para la papa seca.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a member of the Señor de Yana Ñawi Communal Bank. She is 37 years old and the mother of five children. She has been in Finca Perú for three years. She sells wholesale dried potatoes. She is grateful to the Finca for the things that she has learned. There is no other place where she was able to better herself like in the trainings she received from her Communal Bank. Now, with the loan, she will invest in the purchase of potatoes in order to process them into dried potatoes.

loans.use: purchase potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Yana Ñawi, se dedica a la venta de verduras, es madre de 3 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, es una madre que ha luchado mucho por salir adelante con sus hijos, ella aprendió mucho en Finca Perú, le enseñaron acerca del ahorro, la responsabilidad, la puntualidad y eso Lola le instruye a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de verduras.
texts.en: Lola is a member of the Yana Ñawi communal bank. She sells vegetables, is the mother of 3 children, and has been a member of Finca Perú for 4 years. As a mother, she has fought to support her children. She learned a lot from Finca Perú; they taught her about saving, responsibility, and promptness. Lola teaches her children these principles. She is now requesting a loan to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Amalia has a shop that sells fish like trout, mackerel, and sardines. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Amalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Yana Ñawi, tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es conviviente, se dedica a la venta de emoliente, es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 1 año, antes se dedicaba a la venta de queso, ahora con la venta de emoliente puede ayudar con los estudios de sus hijos, las capitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener mas base para poder educar mas a sus hijos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, linaza.
texts.en: Lucila is a member of the Yana Ñawi communal bank. She is 30 years old, the mother of 2 children, and a live-in partner. She sells hot beverages and has been a member of Finca Peru for one year. Before she sold cheese, but by selling hot beverages she is now able to help with her children's education. Her training allows her a broader basis with which to educate her children. With this loan, she will will invest in the purchase of sugar and linseed.

loans.use: to buy sugar and linseed.

loans.name: Marita Group

texts.en:
Marita is 55 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. She is married and has three children.  

Marita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for four years. Marita requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Marita has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Marita is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
